semetra: <entryFree id="n43426" type="hapax" key="se_me^tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-mĕtra</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>metrum</etym>, <sense id="n43426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irregular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inharmonious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissona,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 826</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semi: <entryFree id="n43427" type="main" key="se_mi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmi-</orth> (also, before vowels, merely sēm-, and before libra, mestris, from mensis, and modius, sē-), an inseparable particle [Sanscr. sāmi; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">h(mi-, h(/misus;</foreign> cf. semis], <sense id="n43427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half</hi>, <hi rend="ital">demi-</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semi-;</hi> as, semestris, <hi rend="ital">semi-monthly;</hi> semesus, <hi rend="ital">half-eaten;</hi> semideus, <hi rend="ital">demigod</hi>, etc.; hence, also, for <hi rend="ital">small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">light</hi>, etc.; as, semicinctium, semifunium, semipiscina, <pb n="1665" /> <cb n="SEMI" /> semispatha, al.—Only a very few of these compounds are ante-Aug.; most of them, indeed, belong only to the post-class. per.</sense></entryFree>
semiacerbus: <entryFree id="n43428" type="hapax" key="se_mi^a^cerbus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ăcerbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfsour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-ripe</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semiadapertus: <entryFree id="n43429" type="hapax" key="se_mi^a^da^pertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ădăpertus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">quinquesyl.</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>adaperio</etym>, <sense id="n43429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-opened</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">janua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semiadopertulus: <entryFree id="n43430" type="hapax" key="se_mi^a^do^pertu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ăd-ŏpertŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>operio</etym>, <sense id="n43430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-shut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-closed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, 135, 34</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semiagrestis: <entryFree id="n43431" type="hapax" key="se_mi^a^grestis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ăgrestis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">somewhat boorish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maximianus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Caes. 39" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Caes. 39 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
semiambustus: <entryFree id="n43432" type="main" key="se_mi^ambustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ambustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amburo</etym>, <sense id="n43432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-burned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-consumed</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">cadaver,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:59" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:681" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 681</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semiamictus: <entryFree id="n43433" type="main" key="se_mi^a^mictus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ămictus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amicio</etym>, <sense id="n43433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-clad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-naked</hi> (Appuleian), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7</bibl>, p. 189, 37.</sense></entryFree>
semiamputatus: <entryFree id="n43434" type="hapax" key="se_mi^ampu^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ampŭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>amputo</etym>, <sense id="n43434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half cut off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-trimmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lopped</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pruned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 104, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semianimis: <entryFree id="n43435" type="main" key="se_mi^a^ni^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ănĭmis</orth> (in verse, per synizesin, read as a quadrisyl.; and in some editions also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmănĭmis</orth>), <itype>e</itype> <etym>anima</etym>, and less freq. <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ănĭmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>animus</etym>, <sense id="n43435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-dead</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; syn.: semivivus, seminex). </sense><sense id="n43435.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Form semianimis: semianimes micant oculi, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 10, 396</bibl> (Ann. v. 463 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">semianimesque micant digiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 396</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 404</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 686</bibl>; 11, 635; 12, 356; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 339</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:123 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 123 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57:4" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 57, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes">40, 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:27:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 27, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:37:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 37, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Prov. 4:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Prov. 4, 11</bibl>; id. Ira, 3, 4, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:8:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 8, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:49 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 49 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43435.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Form semanimus (or semian-): <cit><quote lang="la">semanimo corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 1268</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Cic. poët. Div. 1, 47, 106: lepus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 9, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:37" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:83" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 3:67:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 3, 67, 16</bibl></cit> Dietsch.</sense></entryFree>
semiannuus: <entryFree id="n43436" type="hapax" key="se_mi^annu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-annŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">lasting half a year</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox (in insulā Thule),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 595</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semiapertus: <entryFree id="n43437" type="hapax" key="se_mi^a^pertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ăpertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>aperio</etym>, <sense id="n43437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-opened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-open</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fores portarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
semiatratus: <entryFree id="n43438" type="hapax" key="se_mi^a^tra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ătrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in half-black</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in half-mourning</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 107, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semiaxius: <entryFree id="n43439" type="hapax" key="se_mi^axi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-axĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>axis</etym>, <sense id="n43439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appellation of the early Christians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">derived from the manner of their martyrdom</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">licet nunc sarmentitios et semiaxios appelletis, quia ad stipitem dimidii axis revincti, sarmentorum ambitu uriemur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semibarbarus: <entryFree id="n43440" type="main" key="se_mi^barba^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-barbărus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">semibarbarous</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">Galli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:76" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs Leptis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Jovin. 1, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semibos: <entryFree id="n43441" type="main" key="se_mi^bo_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-bōs</orth>, <itype>bŏvis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-ox</hi> (Ovidian): <cit><quote lang="la">vir,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Minotaur</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:7:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 7, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semicanaliculus: <entryFree id="n43442" type="hapax" key="se_mi^ca^na_li^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-cănālĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the halfchannel</hi> or <hi rend="ital">groove on the edge of a triglyph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semicanis: <entryFree id="n43443" type="main" key="se_mi^ca^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-cănis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n43443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-dog</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semicanes dei,</quote> <trans><tr>the Egyptian god Anubis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 832</bibl></cit> Weise.</sense></entryFree>
semicanus: <entryFree id="n43444" type="main" key="se_mi^ca_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-cānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-gray</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grizzled</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">comae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 231, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cincinni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 212, 27.</sense></entryFree>
semicaper: <entryFree id="n43445" type="main" key="se_mi^ca^per"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-căper</orth>, <itype>pri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-goat</hi> (Ovidian), an epithet of Pan, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 515</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a Faun,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 101</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semicentesima: <entryFree id="n43446" type="hapax" key="se_mi^cente_si^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-centēsĭma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one-half per cent.</hi>, as an impost, Cod. Th. 13, 9, 3.</sense></entryFree>
semichristianus: <entryFree id="n43447" type="main" key="Se_mi^christi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēmĭ-christĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-Christian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Gal. 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semicinctium: <entryFree id="n43448" type="main" key="se_mi^cincti^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-cinctĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a semi-girdle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a narrow girdle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">apron</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:153" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 153</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 94, 8</bibl> (al. hemicyclo); <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:19:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 19, 12</bibl>; cf. semifunium.</sense></entryFree>
semicirculatus: <entryFree id="n43449" type="hapax" key="se_mi^circu^la_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭcircŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>semicirculus</etym>, <sense id="n43449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">semicircular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferramentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semicirculus: <entryFree id="n43450" type="main" key="se_mi^circu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-circŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">semicircular</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-circŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a half-circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semicircle</hi> (syn. semiorbis): <cit><quote lang="la">uncus in semicirculi speciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>semicircular</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 2, 8</bibl></cit>. <cb n="SEMI" /></sense></entryFree>
semiclausus: <entryFree id="n43451" type="main" key="se_mi^clausus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-clausus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-clūsus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>claudo</etym>, <sense id="n43451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-shut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-closed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">SILVANE SEMICLVSE FRAXINO (because only half was visible),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1613</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semicoctus: <entryFree id="n43452" type="main" key="se_mi^coctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-coctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>coquo</etym>, <sense id="n43452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfcooked</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-done</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 11, 29, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:145" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 70, § 145</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 27, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semicombustus: <entryFree id="n43453" type="main" key="se_mi^combustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-combustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>comburo</etym>, <sense id="n43453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-burned</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-consumed</hi>, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">ste*f.</foreign> 10, 859; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semiconfectus: <entryFree id="n43454" type="hapax" key="se_mi^confectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-confectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conficio</etym>, <sense id="n43454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-made</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caespes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semiconspicuus: <entryFree id="n43455" type="hapax" key="se_mi^conspi^cu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-conspĭcŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>conspicio</etym>, <sense id="n43455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-visible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnulli per fenestras,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 130, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semicorporalis: <entryFree id="n43456" type="hapax" key="se_mi^corpo^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-corpŏrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corpus</etym>, <sense id="n43456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-bodied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having but half its body visible</hi>: signum (Aries), Firm. Math. 2, 12; cf. semicorporeus.</sense></entryFree>
semicorporeus: <entryFree id="n43457" type="main" key="se_mi^corpo^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-corpŏrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having but half its body visible</hi>: signum (Cancer), Firm. Math. 2, 12; cf. semicorporalis.</sense></entryFree>
semicorporis: <entryFree id="n43458" type="main" key="se_mi^corpo^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-corpŏris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having half a body</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semicorrectus: <entryFree id="n43459" type="main" key="se_mi^correctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-correctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>corrigo</etym>, <sense id="n43459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-corrected</hi> (late Lat.), Aug. c. Mend. 3, 6.</sense></entryFree>
semicrematus: <entryFree id="n43460" type="main" key="se_mi^cre^ma_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-crĕmātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cremo</etym>, <sense id="n43460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-burned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:636" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 636</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:54:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 54, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. semicremus.</sense></entryFree>
semicremus: <entryFree id="n43461" type="hapax" key="se_mi^cre^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-crĕmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfburned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 287</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semicrudus: <entryFree id="n43462" type="main" key="se_mi^cru_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-crūdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n43462.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Halfraw</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:13" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lupinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:25" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 25</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n43462.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That has but half-digested</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:48" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semicubitalis: <entryFree id="n43463" type="hapax" key="se_mi^cu^bi^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-cŭbĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cubitum</etym>, <sense id="n43463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-cubit long</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:65:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 65, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semicupae: <entryFree id="n43464" type="hapax" key="se_mi^cu_pae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-cūpae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cupa</etym>, <sense id="n43464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a halftun;</hi> as a term of reproach, i. q. <hi rend="ital">pot-belly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fat-paunch</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semideus: <entryFree id="n43465" type="main" key="se_mi^de^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-dĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-divine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heroes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Argonauts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:373" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 373</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also, reges,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 518</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acnill. 2, 363</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">parentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:376" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 9, 376</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Anubis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 832</bibl></cit> (al. semicanes dei): <cit><quote lang="la">Dryades,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nymphae semideumque genus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 82</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Silvanus arbiter umbrae Semideumque pecus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Pans</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:112" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 112</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43465.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-dĕus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a demigod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semideique deique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 673</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 192</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43465.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-dĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a demigoddess</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tres volucres, tres semideae, tres semipuellae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Sirens</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 21</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semidies: <entryFree id="n43466" type="main" key="se_mi^di^es"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-dĭes</orth>, <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-day</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. Rat. Dier. 5</bibl>, and Rat. Solst. 2.</sense></entryFree>
semidigitalis: <entryFree id="n43467" type="main" key="se_mi^di^gi^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-dĭgĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <sense id="n43467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj</hi> , <hi rend="ital">of the size of half a finger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half a digit in diameter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">foramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semidivinus: <entryFree id="n43468" type="hapax" key="se_mi^di_vi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-dīvīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-divine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semi-divine</hi>: locus ex oratione tuā, M. Aur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep ad Caes. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep ad Caes. 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semidoctus: <entryFree id="n43469" type="main" key="se_mi^doctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-doctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-taught</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-learned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">discipulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:1:3:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 1, 3, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec ut et properans et apud doctos et semidoctus ipse percurro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:42:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 42, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grammaticus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:9:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus villici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:92:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 92, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semiermis: <entryFree id="n43470" type="main" key="se_mi^ermis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ermis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmerm-</orth>, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 1, 15</bibl> Drak.; cf. semesus), e (in Liv.), and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ermus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēmerm-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype> (in Tac.), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>arma</etym>, <sense id="n43470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-armed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">badly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">indifferently armed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille semermes per agros palati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 50</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum sex milibus semiermium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:28" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:41" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 41</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">40, 58: hosti et paucos ac semermos cogitanti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 39</bibl> and 45.</sense></entryFree>
semiesus: <entryFree id="n43471" type="main" key="se_mi^e_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭēsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. semesus.</entryFree>
semifactus: <entryFree id="n43472" type="main" key="se_mi^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-factus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>facio</etym>, <sense id="n43472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfmade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-finished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 7</bibl></cit>: portae valli, Auct. B. Afr. 83, 3.</sense></entryFree>
semifastigium: <entryFree id="n43473" type="hapax" key="se_mi^fasti_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-fastīgĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-pediment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
semifer: <entryFree id="n43474" type="main" key="se_mi^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-fer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ferus</etym>, <sense id="n43474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfbestial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half man and half beast.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43474.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">semifer interea divinae stirpis alumno Laetus erat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Centaur Chiron</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 633</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the Centaurs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:406" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 406</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:9:220" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 9, 220</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 386</bibl>: caput Panis, Lucr. <cb n="SEMI" /> 4, 587: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus (Tritonis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus Capricorni (because half goat and half fish),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 59</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">species hominum (with portenta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:702" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 702</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43474.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">half-wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-savage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cacus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 267</bibl></cit> (for which, semihomo, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 194</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">glires semiferum animal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 57, 82, § 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proles (canis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyn. 253</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:542" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 542</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semiformis: <entryFree id="n43475" type="main" key="se_mi^formis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-formis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>forma</etym>, <sense id="n43475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfformed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:5:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luna,</quote> <trans><tr>a halfmoon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:25:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 25, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semifultus: <entryFree id="n43476" type="hapax" key="se_mi^fultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-fultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fulcio</etym>, <sense id="n43476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-propped</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:14:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 14, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semifumans: <entryFree id="n43477" type="main" key="se_mi^fu_mans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-fūmans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fumo</etym>, <sense id="n43477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfsmoking;</hi> trop.: dignitas praefecturae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">still warm</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fresh</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semifunium: <entryFree id="n43478" type="hapax" key="se_mi^fu_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-fūnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>funis</etym>, <sense id="n43478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a halfrope</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a slender line</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cord</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 135, 5</bibl>; cf. semicinctium.</sense></entryFree>
semigaetulus: <entryFree id="n43479" type="main" key="Se_mi^gaetu_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēmĭ-gaetūlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-Gœtulian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semi-Gœtulian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 289, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semigermanus: <entryFree id="n43480" type="main" key="Se_mi^germa_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēmĭ-germānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfGerman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semi-German</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
semigraece: <entryFree id="n43481" type="main" key="Se_mi^graece_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēmĭgraecē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. semigraecus <sense id="n43481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
semigraeculus: <entryFree id="n43482" type="main" key="Se_mi^graecu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēmĭgraecŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>semigraecus</etym>, <sense id="n43482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little half-Greek</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 50, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semigraecus: <entryFree id="n43483" type="main" key="Se_mi^graecus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēmĭ-graecus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfGreek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semi-Grecian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poëtae et oratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas (Tarentum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18, 6</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēmĭgraecē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">half in the Greek manner</hi>: quod dicimus, Lucil. ap. Vel. Long. p. 2214 P.</sense></entryFree>
semigravis: <entryFree id="n43484" type="hapax" key="se_mi^gra^vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-grăvis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-overcome</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vino,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>half-drunken</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 24, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
semigro: <entryFree id="n43485" type="hapax" key="se_mi^_gro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-mĭ_gro</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n43485.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> from any one: <cit><quote lang="la">a patre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:7:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 7, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semihians: <entryFree id="n43486" type="main" key="se_mi^hi^ans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-hĭans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>hio</etym>, <sense id="n43486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfopened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-open</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">labellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 220</bibl></cit>; cf. labiae, App. M: 10, p. 252, 32; cf. semihiulcus.</sense></entryFree>
semihiulcus: <entryFree id="n43487" type="main" key="se_mi^hi^ulcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-hĭulcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-opened</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-open</hi>: savium, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:11:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 11, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 2, 17</bibl>; cf. semihians.</sense></entryFree>
semihomo: <entryFree id="n43488" type="main" key="se_mi^ho^mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-hŏmo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-man</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">half man and half beast.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43488.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Centauri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 536</bibl></cit> (for which, semiferi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:406" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 406</bibl> al.; v. semifer, I.): mandragoras (because formed below like a man), Col. poët. 10, 19.—</sense><sense id="n43488.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">half-human</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">half-wild</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-savage</hi>, = semifer, II.: <cit><quote lang="la">Cacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 194</bibl></cit> (for which, semifer, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 267</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Nasamones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:180" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 180</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

R. 3, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semimares capi (appellantur), cum sint castrati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:588" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 588</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Galli (the priests of Cybele),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:183" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 183</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 18, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vascula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. R. 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43515.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭnārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a nursery</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nursery-garden</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seed-plot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seminary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43515.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:295" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 27, 71, § 295</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:16" default="NO">11, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:30" default="NO">11, 2, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arb. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:1" default="NO">2, 1</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n43515.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">seminarium rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:17:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 17, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fons et seminarium triumphorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:40:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 40, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilinarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">judicum (veterani),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatūs (equites),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:61:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 61, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exiguum militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostilis exercitus (Hispania),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:6:38" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 6, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:6:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: dulce hilaritatis (vinum), Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 28, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scelerum omnium (Bacchanalia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39</bibl></cit> epit.: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium malorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 74, p. 321, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rixarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 27, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repudii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Helv. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

R. 2:6:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6, 3</bibl>; Ambros. de Noë, 29, 107.</sense></entryFree>
seminator: <entryFree id="n43517" type="main" key="se_mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an originator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">producer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author</hi> (Ciceronian). </sense><sense id="n43517.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">seminator et sator et parens omnium rerum (mundus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:34:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 34, 86</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43517.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnium malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 26, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam fallaciae seminatores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
seminecis: <entryFree id="n43518" type="main" key="se_mi^ne^cis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-nĕcis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>nom.</case> does not occur), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>nex</etym>, <sense id="n43518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-dead</hi> (not ante-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. semivivus): alicui semineci rapere arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 462</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seminecem eum ad Cannas in acervo caesorum corporum inventum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 15</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">seminecem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:275" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 275</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:9:19" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:456" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 456</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semineces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 455</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 329</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:176" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 176</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">seminecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:164" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:11" default="NO">6, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seminium: <entryFree id="n43519" type="main" key="se_mi^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>semen</etym>, <sense id="n43519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a begetting</hi> (of animals), <hi rend="ital">procreation</hi> (ante-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:6:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 6, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43519.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a race</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breed</hi> (of animals), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:3:3" default="NO">2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:9:6" default="NO">3, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:742" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 742</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:746" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 746</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1005" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 1005</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seminiverbius: <entryFree id="n43520" type="main" key="se_mi^ni^verbi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭnĭverbĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>semino-verbum</etym>, <sense id="n43520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scattering words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">babbling</hi> (for Gr. <foreign lang="greek">spermolo/gos</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semino: <entryFree id="n43521" type="main" key="se_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>semen</etym>, <sense id="n43521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sow</hi> (rare; not in Cic.; syn.: sero, planto). </sense><sense id="n43521.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">adoreum, triticum, hordeum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:8:3" default="NO">2, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:15" default="NO">2, 9, 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 9, 16: agrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n43521.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43521.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To beget</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engender</hi>, <hi rend="ital">procreate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter decumo post mense nascetur puer quam seminatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:3" default="NO">6, 24, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:4" default="NO">6, 37, 4</bibl> sq.—* </sense><sense id="n43521.4" n="2" level="3"> Of plants, <hi rend="ital">to bring forth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">produce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">viscum quod non sua seminat arbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 206</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43521.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultum dei per terram,</quote> <trans><tr>to plant</tr>, <tr>propagate</tr>, <tr>disseminate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 22, 26</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 25, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seminosus: <entryFree id="n43522" type="hapax" key="se_mi^no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of seeds</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cucurbitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 51, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
seminudus: <entryFree id="n43523" type="main" key="se_mi^nu_dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-nūdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-naked</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n43523.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">consules, prope seminudi sub jugum missi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:40" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 40</bibl>; <cb n="SEMI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Princ. Hist. p. 318" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Princ. Hist. p. 318</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille seminudus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 6:2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 6, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43523.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">half-unarmed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almost defenceless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes vagus et prope seminudus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 35, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43523.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad Anton. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad Anton. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
seminumida: <entryFree id="n43524" type="main" key="Se_mi^nu^mi^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēmĭ-nŭmĭda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-Numidian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half a Numidian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 289, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semiobolus: <entryFree id="n43525" type="hapax" key="se_mi^o^bo^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ŏbŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-obolus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rhem. Fan.</author> Pond. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 16, 25, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semiobrutus: <entryFree id="n43526" type="hapax" key="se_mi^obru^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-obrŭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>obruo</etym>, <sense id="n43526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-covered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 219, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semionustus: <entryFree id="n43527" type="hapax" key="se_mi^o^nustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ŏnustus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfladen</hi>: naves, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 909</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
semiorbis: <entryFree id="n43528" type="main" key="se_mi^orbis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-orbis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semicircle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 8, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">22, 8, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semipaganus: <entryFree id="n43529" type="hapax" key="se_mi^pa_ga_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-pāgānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-rustic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half a clown</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 6" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semipatens: <entryFree id="n43530" type="hapax" key="se_mi^pa^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-pătens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pateo</etym>, <sense id="n43530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">standing half-open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-open</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestibula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semipedalis: <entryFree id="n43531" type="main" key="se_mi^pe^da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-pĕdālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-foot in size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half a foot long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broad</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">apertura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 19</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:52:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 52, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 42, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 13, 4, 8, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisciculus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll. art.</sense></entryFree>
semipedaneus: <entryFree id="n43532" type="hapax" key="se_mi^pe^da_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-pĕdānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a halffoot in size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half a foot long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">broad</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:1:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semiperactus: <entryFree id="n43533" type="hapax" key="se_mi^pe^ractus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-pĕractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perago</etym>, <sense id="n43533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-finished</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 20, 299</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semiperemptus: <entryFree id="n43534" type="hapax" key="se_mi^pe^remptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-pĕremptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perimo</etym>, <sense id="n43534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-destroyed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugera,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. Sodom. 133</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semiperfectus: <entryFree id="n43535" type="main" key="se_mi^perfectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-perfectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perficio</etym>, <sense id="n43535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-finished.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43535.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera absolvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Spirit. Sanc. 3, 14, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43535.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutes,</quote> <trans><tr>half-perfect</tr>, <tr>incomplete</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Dogm. Plat. 2, p. 17, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semiperitus: <entryFree id="n43536" type="hapax" key="se_mi^pe^ri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-pĕrītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfskilled</hi> (with semidoctus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semipersa: <entryFree id="n43537" type="main" key="Se_mi^persa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēmĭ-persa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-Persian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half a Persian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 289, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semipes: <entryFree id="n43538" type="main" key="se_mi^pe_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n43538.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A half-foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half a foot.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43538.1" n="1" level="3"> As a measure of length, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:5:15" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 5, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">latum semipede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimi semipedum mensura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 5, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non altiores quino semipede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 11, 16, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intervallo duum pedum et semipedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 20, 33, § 144</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43538.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A half-foot</hi> in verse, Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:15:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 15, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 86</bibl>; Aug. de Musica, 5, 11.—</sense><sense id="n43538.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Half-lame</hi>: crure trunco semipes, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">ste*f.</foreign> 2, 150.</sense></entryFree>
semiphalarica: <entryFree id="n43539" type="gloss" key="se_mi^pha^la_ri^ca"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-phălārĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small</hi> phalarica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:25:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 25, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semipiscina: <entryFree id="n43540" type="hapax" key="se_mi^pisci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-piscīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small fishpond</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 13, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semiplacentinus: <entryFree id="n43541" type="main" key="Se_mi^pla^centi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēmĭ-plăcentīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-Placentine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half a Placentine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 6, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semiplene: <entryFree id="n43542" type="main" key="se_mi^ple_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭplēnē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. semiplenus <sense id="n43542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
semiplenus: <entryFree id="n43543" type="main" key="se_mi^ple_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-plēnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-full</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">naves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:25:section=63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 25, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrobes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">favi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:15:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes,</quote> <trans><tr>only half-filled</tr>, <tr>half-manned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 80, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:112:2" default="NO">2, 112, 2</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-plēnē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">half in full</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incompletely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicuntur praesentia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 22 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
semiplotia: <entryFree id="n43544" type="gloss" key="se_miploti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmiplotĭa</orth>, <itype>soleae dimidiatae appellantur, quibus utebantur in venando, quo planius pedem ponerent</itype>, Fest. s. v. ploti, p. 238 Müll.</entryFree>
semipuella: <entryFree id="n43545" type="hapax" key="se_mi^pu^ella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-pŭella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-maiden</hi>, as a designation of the Sirens, who were half girl and half bird, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semipullatus: <entryFree id="n43546" type="hapax" key="se_mi^pulla_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-pullātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">clothed in half-black</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusatores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semiputatus: <entryFree id="n43547" type="main" key="se_mi^pu^ta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-pŭtātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>puto</etym>, <sense id="n43547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfpruned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 70</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 37, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semiramis: <entryFree id="n43548" type="main" key="Se^mi_ra^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕmīrămis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Sămērămis</orth>, in good MSS. and Schol., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:108" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 108</bibl>), is or <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*semi/ramis,</foreign> <sense id="n43548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the celebrated queen of Assyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consort and successor of Ninus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:108" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 108</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Semiramin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 6, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 4, 9</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> Semirami, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:2:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 36, 2, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Semiramide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:1:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—So Cicero sarcastically calls the profligate A. Gabinius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 4, 9</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĕmīrămĭus</orth>, <cb n="SEMI" /> <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Semiramis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Semiramian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Semiramio sanguine cretus Polydaemon,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Babylonian</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:28:18" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 28, 18</bibl></cit>; so, turres, Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 162.</sense></entryFree>
semirasus: <entryFree id="n43549" type="main" key="se_mi^ra_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-rāsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rado</etym>, <sense id="n43549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfshaven</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ustor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 59, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 222, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semireductus: <entryFree id="n43550" type="hapax" key="se_mi^re^ductus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-rĕductus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>reduco</etym>, <sense id="n43550.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half bent back</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:614" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 614</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semirefectus: <entryFree id="n43551" type="hapax" key="se_mi^re^fectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-rĕfectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>reficio</etym>, <sense id="n43551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-repaired</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">laniata classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 176</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semirosus: <entryFree id="n43552" type="hapax" key="se_mi^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-rōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>rodo</etym>, <sense id="n43552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfgnawed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 202</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semirotundus: <entryFree id="n43553" type="main" key="se_mi^ro^tundus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-rŏtundus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semicircular</hi> (Appuleian): <cit><quote lang="la">subterraneum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 260, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suggestus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 160, 2.</sense></entryFree>
semirutus: <entryFree id="n43554" type="main" key="se_mi^ru^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-rŭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ruo</etym>, <sense id="n43554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfpulled down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-overthrown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-demolished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-destroyed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-ruined</hi> (not anteAug.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in the historians, esp. in Liv.): murus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:17" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vallum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:24" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">plus negotii fuit cum semirutā Karthagine quam cum integrā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:15:13" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 15, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 32</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">telae confuso stamine,</quote> <trans><tr>half-torn</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 155</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Neutr. plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭrŭta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">partim per semiruta partim scalis integros muros transcendere,</quote> <trans><tr>the halfdemolished parts of the wall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 24, 6</bibl></cit> (dub.; <cit><quote lang="la">Weissenb. semirutos): semiruta moenium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 350, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semis: <entryFree id="n43555" type="main" key="se_mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmis</orth>, <itype>issis</itype> (in Vitr., Front., and Pall. <itype>indecl.</itype>, e.g. duo semis pedes, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 9, 10</bibl>: <sense id="n43555.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">duobus semis pedibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Jan. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diametros octo semis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">passuum milium et semis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">habere duos et semis cubitos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 10 al.</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cf. semi-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">h(mi-, h(/misu</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">a half</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-unity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a semi-unit</hi> (v. as, I.). </sense><sense id="n43555.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare for the usual dimidium): <cit><quote lang="la">sex domini semissem Africae possidebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 7, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrimonii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:36:1:78:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 36, 1, 78, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e libertorum defunctorum bonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alter semissem, alter universa fratre excluso (sibi vindicaret),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panem semissem ponebat supra torum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 64, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43555.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n43555.3" n="A" level="2"> As a coin, </sense><sense id="n43555.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Half an</hi> as, <hi rend="ital">a semi</hi>-as, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=171" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 171</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 708</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex frumentaria de semissibus et trientibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 12, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:25:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 25, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 60</bibl>; Ascon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:4, p. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 4, p. 9</bibl> Orell.; hence, non semissis homo, <hi rend="ital">not worth a groat</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">good for nothing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi>, Vatin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 10</bibl> a, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">quid fit! Semis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:330" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 330</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43555.5" n="2" level="3"> In the times of the later emperors, as a gold coin, <hi rend="ital">a half</hi> aureus (containing 59.8 grains of gold, or the present value of 10<hi rend="ital">s.</hi> 6 3/4<hi rend="ital">d.</hi> sterling), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 39</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43555.6" n="B" level="2"> As a rate of interest, <hi rend="ital">one half per cent. a month</hi>, or, acc. to our mode of computation, <hi rend="ital">six per cent. a year</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bes, triens, etc.): semissibus magna copia (pecuniae) est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usura multiplicata semissibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usura semissium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:9 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 9 sq.</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also, reversely: semisses usurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in apposition: semisses usuras promisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:45:134" default="NO">22, 45, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:102" default="NO">46, 3, 102</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n43555.7" n="C" level="2"> As a measure of dimension. </sense><sense id="n43555.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Half a juger</hi> of land: <cit><quote lang="la">bina jugera et semisses agri assignati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 19, 49, § 178</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43555.9" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A half-foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half a foot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interesse sesquipedes inter bina semina in latitudinem, in longitudinem semisses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">campestris locus alte duos pedes et semissem infodiendus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 7" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Febr. 9, 10</bibl> et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 40, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 11, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43555.10" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Half a cubit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubitum ac semissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:25:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 25, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43555.11" n="D" level="2"> Among mathematicians, <hi rend="ital">the number three</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 1, 6</bibl>; cf. as <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
semisaucius: <entryFree id="n43556" type="hapax" key="se_mi^sauci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-saucĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfwounded;</hi> trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 8:8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 8, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semisenex: <entryFree id="n43557" type="hapax" key="se_mi^se^nex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-sĕnex</orth>, <itype>sĕnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an oldish</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elderly man</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 53</bibl> (dub.).</sense></entryFree>
