semisepultus: <entryFree id="n43558" type="hapax" key="se_mi^se^pultus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-sĕpultus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sepelio</etym>, <sense id="n43558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-buried</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 55</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semisermo: <entryFree id="n43559" type="hapax" key="se_mi^sermo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-sermo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-speech</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a jargon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">barbarus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semisiccus: <entryFree id="n43560" type="hapax" key="se_mi^siccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-siccus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-dry</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">thalli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 24, 4</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1667" /> <cb n="SEMI" /></sense></entryFree>
semisomnus: <entryFree id="n43561" type="main" key="se_mi^somnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-somnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-somnis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>somnus</etym>, <sense id="n43561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-asleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleepy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowsy</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tibi siccae semisomnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:36:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 36, § 95</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 21:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:39" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 39</bibl> Drak.; 30, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 37, 20; 40, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 22</bibl>: sopor, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 14, 13</bibl></cit>.—Form semisomnis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 14:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 14, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semisonans: <entryFree id="n43562" type="main" key="se_mi^so^nans"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-sŏnans</orth>, <itype>antis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sono</etym>, <sense id="n43562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfsounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semi-vocal</hi>: littera, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a semivowel</hi>, App. de Mundo, 16, 29; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Carm. Her. p. 2406</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 1, 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semisopitus: <entryFree id="n43563" type="hapax" key="se_mi^so_pi_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-sōpītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sopio</etym>, <sense id="n43563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-asleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleepy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowsy</hi> (for the class. semisomnus), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 109, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semisoporus: <entryFree id="n43564" type="hapax" key="se_mi^so^po_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-sŏpōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sopor</etym>, <sense id="n43564.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-asleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sleepy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drowsy</hi> (for the class. semisomnus), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 11, 59</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semispatha: <entryFree id="n43565" type="main" key="se_mi^spa^tha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-spătha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi> spatha, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semissalis: <entryFree id="n43566" type="main" key="se_missa_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmissālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>semis</etym>, <sense id="n43566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a half-</hi>as: usurae, i.e. <hi rend="ital">a half-</hi>as <hi rend="ital">a month</hi> (six per cent. a year), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:12:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 12, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semissarius: <entryFree id="n43567" type="main" key="se_missa_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmissārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a half-</hi>as: <cit><quote lang="la">coheres,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>who inherits one half</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:116" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 116</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semissis: <entryFree id="n43568" type="main" key="se_missis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmissis</orth>, v. semis.</entryFree>
semisso: <entryFree id="n43569" type="main" key="se_misso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmisso</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>semis, II. C. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n43569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to fire</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cauterize one half</hi> of a horse's foot: <cit><quote lang="la">pedes equorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 26, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 10, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semisupinus: <entryFree id="n43570" type="main" key="se_mi^su^pi_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-sŭpīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half bent backwards</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-supine</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">jacet in dextrum semisupina latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:788" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 788</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 14, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 10, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:35:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 35, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semita: <entryFree id="n43571" type="main" key="se_mi^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen><etym>se-(=sed-), i.e. aside; and root mi-, to go; cf.: meo, trames</etym>, <sense id="n43571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a narrow way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a path</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foot - path</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by - way</hi>, etc. (opp. via, a highway; cf.: callis, trames): quā ibant, ab itu iter appellarunt; <cit><quote lang="la">quā id anguste, semita ut semiter, dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=35" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 35</bibl></cit> Müll. </sense><sense id="n43571.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">angustissimae semitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 96</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:61:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 61, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut viam aut semitam monstrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decedam ego illi de viā, de semitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 80</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 64:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 64, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scabras lutosasque semitas spectant, id. Ira, 3, 35, 5: omnibus viis notis semitisque essedarios ex silvis emittebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 19</bibl></cit>; so (opp. via) <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semita angusta et ardua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut Oresti nuper prandia in semitis decumae nomine magno honori fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 17, 58</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl>; Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:20:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 20, 40</bibl> (Ann. v. 44 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">rara per occultos lucebat semita calles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 383</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā jacet Herculeis semita litoribus,</quote> <trans><tr>the narrow way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:11:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 11, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 36</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:23" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 23</bibl></cit> (3, 17), 1.—Prov.: qui sibi semitam non sapiunt, alteri monstrant viam, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl> (Trag. v. 358 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">de viā in semitam degredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 40</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43571.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of other ways or paths (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">formicae praedam Convectant calle angusto ... opere omnis semita fervet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 407</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 30, 36, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phryxi quā semita jungi Europamque Asiamque vetat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 409</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spumea semita fugientis clavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:420" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velox Lunae pigraque Saturni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 438</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umida Iridis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aratri, id. de Apono, 25: arteriae, id est spiritus semitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:219" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 89, § 219</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43571.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (rare but class.), <hi rend="ital">a way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">path</hi>, <hi rend="ital">road</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locuples et speciosa vult esse eloquentia ... feratur ergo non semitis, sed campis: non uti fontes angustis fistulis colliguntur, sed ut latissimi amnes totis vallibus fluat ac sibi viam, si quando non acceperit, faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illius ego semita feci viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3, prol. 38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, prol. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam intellegetis, hanc pecuniam, quae via modo visa est exire ab isto, eandem semita revertisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:23:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 23, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secretum iter et fallentis semita vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semita certe Tranquillae per virtutem patet unica vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:364" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novum ad victoriam iter sanguinis sui semita aperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:14:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>; so in eccl. Lat., freq., of a <hi rend="ital">way of life</hi>, <hi rend="ital">course of conduct</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">justitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 17</bibl></cit>. <cb n="SEMO" /></sense></entryFree>
semitactus: <entryFree id="n43572" type="hapax" key="se_mi^tactus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-tactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tango</etym>, <sense id="n43572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-touched</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:74:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 74, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semitalis: <entryFree id="n43573" type="hapax" key="se_mi^ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭtālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>semita</etym>, <sense id="n43573.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">be longing to foot-paths</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by-ways</hi>: dei, <hi rend="ital">whose statues are placed in by-ways</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">e)nodioi</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cat. 8, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semitarius: <entryFree id="n43574" type="hapax" key="se_mi^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭtārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to lanes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">by-ways</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moechi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:37:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 37, 16</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semitatim: <entryFree id="n43575" type="hapax" key="se_mi^ta_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭtātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">through byways</hi>: semitatim fugere, Titin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 194</bibl> P. (Com. Rel. p. 117 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
semitectus: <entryFree id="n43576" type="main" key="se_mi^tectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-tectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tego</etym>, <sense id="n43576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfcovered</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">nudis scapulis aut semitectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 25:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 25, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capuli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">femora (Dianae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 6, 209</bibl></cit>: exercitus, Amm 19, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
semitonium: <entryFree id="n43577" type="hapax" key="se_mi^to^ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-tŏnĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>tonus</etym>, <sense id="n43577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a halftone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semitone</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
semitractatus: <entryFree id="n43578" type="hapax" key="se_mi^tracta_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-tractātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tracto</etym>, <sense id="n43578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-treated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">materia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Fug. in Persec. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semitrepidus: <entryFree id="n43579" type="hapax" key="se_mi^tre^pi^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-trĕpĭdus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halftrembling</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 191, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semitritus: <entryFree id="n43580" type="main" key="se_mi^tri_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-trītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>tero</etym>, <sense id="n43580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">halfthrashed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">frumenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:24" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 36, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semiustulo: <entryFree id="n43581" type="main" key="se_mi^ustu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ustŭlo</orth>, v. semustulo.</entryFree>
semiustus: <entryFree id="n43582" type="main" key="se_mi^ustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ustus</orth>, v. semustus.</entryFree>
semivietus: <entryFree id="n43583" type="hapax" key="se_mi^vi^e_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-vĭētus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-shrivelled</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-withered</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:16:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 16, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semivigil: <entryFree id="n43584" type="main" key="se_mi^vi^gil"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-vĭgil</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-awake</hi>, Vict. Fur. Poen. 13.</sense></entryFree>
semivir: <entryFree id="n43585" type="main" key="se_mi^vi^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-vĭr</orth>, <itype>vĭri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-man</hi>, i. q. semihomo and semimas (not anteAug.). </sense><sense id="n43585.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43585.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Half man and half beast</hi>, e. g. the Centaur Chiron. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:380" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 380</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">the Minotaur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 2, 24</bibl></cit> (cf. semibos): <cit><quote lang="la">Nessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 141</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43585.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An hermaphrodite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 386</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 49, 110, § 263</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43585.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">emasculated.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43585.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, of a priest of Cybele (cf. semimas), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:513" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 513</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">semiviri chori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:20" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 17, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formosum adulescentem semivirum reddidit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43585.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unmanly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">womanish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et nunc ille Paris cum semiviro comitatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phryx,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 10, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 2, 363</bibl>.—So esp. of debauchees: <cit><quote lang="la">qui tam atrocem caedem pertinere ad illos semiviros crederent (for which, just before: molles and obsceni viri),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impure ac semivir,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 552</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semivivus: <entryFree id="n43586" type="main" key="se_mi^vi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-vīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-alive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-dead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almost dead</hi> (class.; syn. semianimis). </sense><sense id="n43586.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi hominem fumo excruciatum, semivivum reliquit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:17:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bibulum semivivum reliquerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 2, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 14, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 10, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43586.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum erat reclamatum semivivis mercenariorum vocibus,</quote> <trans><tr>with half-expiring words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:59:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 59, 126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semivocalis: <entryFree id="n43587" type="main" key="se_mi^vo^ca_li^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-vŏcālĭs</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <sense id="n43587.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Half-sounding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">half-talking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">semi-vocal</hi>: instrumentum rusticum, i. e. <hi rend="ital">cattle</hi> (distinguished from vocale, slaves, and mutum, i. e. carts), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 17, 1</bibl>.—In like manner: signum militare, i. e. <hi rend="ital">horns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trumpets</hi>, etc. (distinguished from vocale, words, and mutum, banners), <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43587.1" n="II" level="1"> In gram., as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a semi - vowel</hi> (of which there were, acc. to the old grammarians, the foll. seven: <cit><quote lang="la">f, l, m, n, r, s, x),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:14" default="NO">1, 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 540 sq.</bibl> P.; 564 ib. al.</sense></entryFree>
semivolucris: <entryFree id="n43588" type="hapax" key="se_mi^vo^lucris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-vŏlucris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-winged</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Sirens</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Ep. 1:41" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> Ep. 1, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semivulsus: <entryFree id="n43589" type="main" key="se_mi^vulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-vulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vello</etym>, <sense id="n43589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half torn to pieces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vittae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semizonarius: <entryFree id="n43590" type="hapax" key="se_mi^zo_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-zōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of small girdles</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 42</bibl>; cf. semicinctium.</sense></entryFree>
semnion: <entryFree id="n43591" type="main" key="semnion"><orth extent="full" lang="la">semnion</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant of great virtue</hi>, = theobrotion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 162</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semnones: <entryFree id="n43592" type="main" key="Semno^_nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Semnŏ_nes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*se/mnwnes,</foreign> Strab.; <foreign lang="greek">*se/mnones</foreign>, Ptol., <sense id="n43592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Northern Germany</hi>, in the territory of the mod. <hi rend="ital">Brandenburg</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:106:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 106, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semo: <entryFree id="n43593" type="main" key="Se_mo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēmo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>probably from sēmen</etym>, <sense id="n43593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ancient god that presided over the crops</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">SEMVNIS ALTERNEI ADVOCAPIT CONCTOS, song of the Fratres Arvales,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2270</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">an epithet of Sancus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:214" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1860</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6999</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semodialis: <entryFree id="n43594" type="main" key="se_mo^di^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmŏdĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>semodius</etym>, <sense id="n43594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing<cb n="SEMP" />  a half-peck</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">placenta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 76, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">olla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 16 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
semodius: <entryFree id="n43595" type="main" key="se_mo^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-mŏdĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>semi-</etym>, <sense id="n43595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-peck</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:5" default="NO">6, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:53:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 53, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semonia: <entryFree id="n43596" type="main" key="Se_mo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēmōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>semen; cf. Semo</etym>, <sense id="n43596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess of the Romans that presided over the crops</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semote: <entryFree id="n43597" type="main" key="se_mo_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmōtē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. semoveo, <sense id="n43597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
semotus: <entryFree id="n43598" type="main" key="se_mo_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from semoveo.</entryFree>
semoveo: <entryFree id="n43599" type="main" key="se_mo^ve^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-mŏvĕo</orth>, <itype>mōvi, mōtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n43599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to move apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to put aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi> (rare but class.; syn.: sepono, sejungo). </sense><sense id="n43599.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos semotae, nos soli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ante voce praeconis a liberis semovebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 12, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43599.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Strato ab eā disciplinā omnino semovendus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 9, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes sententias eorum omnino a philosophiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:13:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 13, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te a curis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 51</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which, also: curā metuque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egestatem ab dulci vitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 5, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem semovendam esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 8</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">remote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far removed.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43599.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: colloquium petunt semoto a militibus loco, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">munitiones semotarum partium, Auct. B. Alex. 2, 3: longe semota tuemur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:579" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 579</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:288" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 288</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terris semota,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semoti prius tarda necessitas Leti corripuit gradum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 3, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43599.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis divum natura Semota ab nostris rebus sejunctaque longe,</quote> <trans><tr>remote</tr>, <tr>different</tr>, <tr>distinct</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:648" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 648</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura semotu' metuque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semota ab dulci vitā stabilique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 66</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo nihil a sapientis ratione semotius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 5, 15 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eorum disputationes et arcana semotaé dictionis peritus exciperem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of their familiar conversation</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 2</bibl></cit>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmōtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">separately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apart</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semper: <entryFree id="n43600" type="main" key="semper"><orth extent="full" lang="la">semper</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>root sam-; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a(m-</foreign>; v. semel and -per = <foreign lang="greek">para/</foreign>; cf. tantisper</etym>, <sense id="n43600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">always</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at all times</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forever</hi> (cf. usque). </sense><sense id="n43600.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: nequiter factum illud apud vos semper manebit, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus hic apud nos semper liber est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper occant priusquam sarriunt rustici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sat habet favitorum semper, qui recte facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod improbis semper aliqui scrupus in animis haereat, semper iis ante oculos judicia et supplicia versentur: nullum autem emolumentum esse tantum, semper ut timeas, semper ut adesse, semper ut impendere aliquam poenam putes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:16:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 16, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod semper movetur, aeternum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 25, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 53</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non haerent in suis sedibus, sed volucri semper spe rapiuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curavit (Servius Tullius), quod semper in re publicā tenendum est, ne, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>; 3, 14, 23 et saep.: sibi exortam semper florentis Homeri Commemorat speciem (the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)eiqalh/s</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 124</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic vertex nobis semper sublimis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 242</bibl></cit>; cf.: quod Graeci aigleucos (<foreign lang="greek">a)eigleu=kos</foreign>) vocant, hoc est semper mustum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avida ulteriorum semper gens (semper belonging to ulter),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:38:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 38, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si umquam dubitatum est, utrum tribuni plebis vestrā an suā causā seditionum semper auctores fuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 3</bibl></cit> Drak.; <cit><quote lang="la">for which also, without esse (hence apparently adject.): Hasdrubal pacis semper auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 42</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">adversus Sidicinos sumerent arma, suos semper hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—To strengthen the signif., joined with <hi rend="ital">cottidie</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perenne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assidue</hi>, etc. (as in Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)ei\ kaq) h(me/ran, sunexe/s,</foreign> etc.; v. Lidd. and Scott's Lex. under <foreign lang="greek">a)ei</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">ea mihi cottidie Aut ture aut vino aut aliqui semper supplicat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucrum ut perenne vobis semper suppetat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:prol. 14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. prol. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne semper servus currens, iratus senex, etc.... assidue agendi sint mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 39</bibl></cit>; so (with assiduus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:18:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 18, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:686" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 686</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi semper omne vitae spatium famula fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semper et ubique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:9:5" default="NO">3, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:90" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 90</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43600.2" n="II" level="1"> Of continuance within a definite time: <cit><quote lang="la">ego illum antehac hominem semper sum frugi ratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tempus (aestatem) omnes Siciliae semper praetores in itineribus consumere consuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 29</bibl></cit>: quibus studiis semper <pb n="1668" /> <cb n="SEMU" /> fueris, tenemus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:23:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 23, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43600.3" n="2" level="3"> Esp., with <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, of a progressive change (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">rem Romanam Alterum in lustrum meliusque semper, Proroget aevum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:67" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">candidior semper candidiorque veni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43600.4" n="B" level="2"> Distributively, <hi rend="ital">always</hi>, <hi rend="ital">every time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on each occasion</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">rex Creo vigiles nocturnos singulos semper locat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horresco semper, ubi pultare hasce (fores) occipio miser,</quote> <trans><tr>always</tr>, <tr>every time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor partus enixa, septumo semper mense, genuit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 5, 4, § 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bis inter duos exortus lunae adfluunt bisque remeant vicenis quaternisque semper horis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 97, 99, § 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tertio die cibum capere semper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibum capere semper diebus tertiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43600.5" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <hi rend="ital">everywhere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in every place</hi> (like Engl. <hi rend="ital">always</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">proque toro terrae non semper gramen habenti, Incubat infelix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 633</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semperflorium: <entryFree id="n43601" type="hapax" key="semperflo_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">semper-flōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>flos</etym>, = sempervivum, <sense id="n43601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">evergreen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">houseleek</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sempervivus: <entryFree id="n43602" type="main" key="sempervi_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">semper-vīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ever-living</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res (Spiritus sanctus),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 164</bibl></cit>: herba, <hi rend="ital">the plant called also</hi> aizoon, <hi rend="ital">evergreen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">houseleek</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 123</bibl>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sempervīva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>,<gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 3</bibl>. —And in analogy with aizoon (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)ei/zwon</foreign>), <orth extent="full" lang="la">sempervīvum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 160</bibl> (not in Jahn).</sense></entryFree>
sempiterne: <entryFree id="n43603" type="main" key="sempi^terne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sempĭternē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sempiternus <sense id="n43603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> c.</sense></entryFree>
sempiternitas: <entryFree id="n43604" type="main" key="sempi^terni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sempĭternĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>,<gen>f.</gen> <etym>sempiternus</etym>, <sense id="n43604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perpetuity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eternal duration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eternity</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">stabilis mundi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 94, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sempiterno: <entryFree id="n43605" type="main" key="sempi^terno_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sempĭternō</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sempiternus <sense id="n43605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> b.</sense></entryFree>
sempiternum: <entryFree id="n43606" type="main" key="sempi^ternum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sempĭternum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sempiternus <sense id="n43606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> a.</sense></entryFree>
sempiternus: <entryFree id="n43607" type="main" key="sempi^ternus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sempĭternus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>semper; like hesternus and aeternus, from heri and aevum</etym>, <sense id="n43607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">everlasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ever-during</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">continual</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imperishable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">eternal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sempiternal</hi> (cf. aeternus <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; <cit><quote lang="la">very freq. and class.): fragile corpus animus sempiternus movet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 24, 26</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">immortalis memoria et sempiterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum vita sempiterna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aevo sempiterno frui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:13:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 13, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 15, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus stellarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 17, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratias agere sempiternas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 90</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 1, 1, 36</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">verae amicitiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hiemes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis Vestae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 9, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">documentum Persarum sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:9:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoria amicitiae nostrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium senatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 65, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 30</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil umquam nisi sempiternum et divinum animo volutare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil nisi sempiternum spectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,012:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Perd. 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sempiternum,</quote> <trans><tr>forever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 5, 29</bibl></cit> et saep. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>, in three forms (not in Cic.), <hi rend="ital">always</hi>, <hi rend="ital">forever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perpetually.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n43607.1" n="a" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sempĭ-ternum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 1, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43607.2" n="b" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sem-pĭternō</orth>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 194</bibl> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">sempiterno permanet ea materia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 35, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43607.3" n="c" level="4"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sempĭternē</orth>, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 170, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sempronius: <entryFree id="n43608" type="main" key="Sempro_ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Semprōnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>; <orth extent="full" lang="la">Semprōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens. Its most celebrated members were Ti. and C. Sempronius Gracchus, after whom are named the leges Semproniae (v. infra, A.); <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> Sempronia, <hi rend="ital">wife of D. Junius Brutus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and sharer in Catiline</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s conspiracy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 25</bibl> and 40, 5.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n43608.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Semprōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Sempronius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex frumentaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:222" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 62, 222</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Dom. 9, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:63:section=163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 63, § 163</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 8, 18</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Sempronia Horrea,</quote> <trans><tr>a place where</tr>, <tr>by a law of C. Gracchus</tr>, <tr>the public corn was stored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=290" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 290</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:60" default="NO" valid="yes">60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:14 sq" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 14 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 3</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n43608.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Semprō-nĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Sempronius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Sempronian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatusconsultum,</quote> <trans><tr>introduced by C. Sempronius Rufus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clades,</quote> <trans><tr>suffered by the consul C. Sempronius Atratinus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 43, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
semuncia: <entryFree id="n43609" type="main" key="se_munci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēm-uncĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>semi; <cit><quote lang="la">semuncia quod dimidia pars unciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=171" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 171</bibl></cit> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n43609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a half-ounce</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the twenty-fourth</hi> <cb n="SENA" /> <hi rend="ital">part of an</hi> as. </sense><sense id="n43609.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a twenty-fourth part</hi> of any whole: <cit><quote lang="la">facit heredem ex deunce et semunciā Caecinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semunciae horarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 14, 11, § 58</bibl></cit>. —Hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">a trifle</hi>: bona ejus propter alieni aeris magnitudinem semunciā venierunt, <hi rend="ital">for a trifling sum</hi>, qs. <hi rend="ital">for a mere song</hi>, Ascon. ad Cic. Mil. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> p. 54 Orell.— <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevis semuncia recti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:121" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 121</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43609.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of weight, <hi rend="ital">the twentyfourth of a pound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">semuncia auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:25:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 25, § 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:57:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 57, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:21:2" default="NO">12, 21, 2</bibl>.—As a measure of dimension, <hi rend="ital">the twenty-fourth of a</hi> jugeruin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:2:4" default="NO">5, 2, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43609.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A domestic utensil</hi> of unknown capacity, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semuncialis: <entryFree id="n43610" type="hapax" key="se_munci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmuncĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>semuncia</etym>, <sense id="n43610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amounting to a half-ounce</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asses,</quote> <trans><tr>the twenty-fourth part of a pound in weight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 46</bibl></cit> (Jahn, semiunciarius).</sense></entryFree>
semunciarius: <entryFree id="n43611" type="main" key="se_munci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmuncĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">amounting to a half-ounce</hi> (<hi rend="ital">one twentyfourth of an</hi> as): semunciarium tantum ex unciario faenus factum, <hi rend="ital">one twenty-fourth of an</hi> as <hi rend="ital">upon each</hi> as, <hi rend="ital">for a year of ten months</hi>, or, acc. to our mode of computation, <hi rend="ital">five per cent. for a full year</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:27:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 27, 3</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 16, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asses,</quote> <trans><tr>weighing half an ounce</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 46</bibl></cit> Jahn.</sense></entryFree>
semurium: <entryFree id="n43612" type="main" key="Semuri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Semurĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n43612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a field near Rome</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where was a temple of Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
semustulo: <entryFree id="n43613" type="main" key="se_mustu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmustŭlo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ustŭlo</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tĭlo</orth>, v. Beier ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:page=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Tull. p. 33</bibl>, a.; <sense id="n43613.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">Cod. Erf. has semiustilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13, 33</bibl></cit>), no <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> (only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to half burn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to burn in part</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelicissimis lignis semustulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:13:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 13, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">faces mcendisti, quibus semustulatus ille est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Phil 2, 36, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semustulatus effugit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:18:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 18, 33</bibl></cit>; Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 263, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci semustulati venere in potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:6:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 6, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus in amphitheatro semustulandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:75" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 75 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. semustus.</sense></entryFree>
semustus: <entryFree id="n43614" type="main" key="se_mustus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēmustus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">sēmĭ-ustus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>uro</etym>, <sense id="n43614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">half-burned</hi> (not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n43614.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Enceladi semustum fulmine corpus. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 578</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">robora,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 697</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:167" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 167</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:16" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:439 al" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 439 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:119:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 119, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectorum vestigia lacera et semusta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 15 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43614.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">se populare incendium priore consulatu semustum effugisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:40:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 40, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sena: <entryFree id="n43615" type="main" key="Se_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n43615.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the coast of Umbria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Hasdrubal was defeated by M. Livius Salinator</hi> (547 A.U.C.), now <hi rend="ital">Sinigaglia</hi>, Liv 27, 46 sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 3, 10</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n43615.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēnānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Sena</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:48" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43615.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēnensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sena</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <trans><tr>in which Hasdrubal was defeated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43615.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river near the town of Sena</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cesano</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:455" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 455</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:555" default="NO">15, 555</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:407" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 407</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
senaculum: <entryFree id="n43616" type="main" key="se^na_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>senatus</etym>. <sense id="n43616.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig., <hi rend="ital">an open place on the Forum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the Grœcostasis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serving for the meetings of the Senate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senaculum supra Graecostasim, ubi aedis Concordiae et basilica Opimia. Senaculum vocatum, ubi senatus aut ubi seniores consisterent, dictum ut gerusia apud Graecos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=156" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 156</bibl></cit> Müll.; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:2:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 27, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43616.1" n="II" level="1"> Later, in gen., for any <hi rend="ital">council-hall of the Senate</hi> (including the curiae): <cit><quote lang="la">senacula tria fuisse Romae, in quibus senatus haberi solitus sit, memoriae prodidit Nicostratus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=347" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 347</bibl></cit> Müll.; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Elag. 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aurel. 49</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 1, p. 286.</sense></entryFree>
senariolus: <entryFree id="n43617" type="hapax" key="se_na_ri^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēnārĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>senarius</etym>, <sense id="n43617.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little</hi>, <hi rend="ital">insignificant</hi> senarius, or <hi rend="ital">verse of six feet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
senarius: <entryFree id="n43618" type="main" key="se_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>seni</etym>. <sense id="n43618.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">consisting of six each;</hi> fistula, <hi rend="ital">six quarter-digits</hi> (quadrantes) <hi rend="ital">in diameter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 25" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <trans><tr>the number six</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43618.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic.: versus, <hi rend="ital">a verse consisting of six feet</hi> (usu. iambics), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:125" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1, prol. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, prol. 2</bibl>.—More freq. as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:55:184" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 55, 184</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">56, 189</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:140 al" default="NO">9, 4, 140 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
senator: <entryFree id="n43619" type="main" key="se^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>senex</etym>, <sense id="n43619.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a senator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a member of the Roman Senate</hi>, a body consisting originally of one hundred eminent citizens, selected by Romulus for their age, wisdom, and experience, out of the noblest <cb n="SENA" /> families, to be his council in the government. When the Sabines were incorporated with Rome, the number was doubled; and Tarquin the Elder raised it to three hundred; Sulla to four hundred; Julius Cæsar to nine hundred, while Augustus reduced it to six hundred. Originally, patricians alone were eligible to seats in the Senate; but later additions were made from the Knights (v. senatus). The senators were nominated by the kings; and, after they were expelled, by the consuls and dictators. Later, the censors revised the roll of senators every lustrum, excluding members regarded as unworthy. (On the powers of the Senate, the privileges, dress, etc., of its members, v. Dict. of Antiq. s. v. Senatus.) —<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic (senatori) jussa tria sunt: ut assit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:18:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 18, 40</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 49, 215</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:47:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 47, 132</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">56, 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:43" default="NO">11, 1, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 6, 110 al.</bibl>—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 36, 3 al.</bibl>—Out of Rome, of the Nervii, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 28</bibl>.—Of the Rhodians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:35:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 35, 48</bibl>.—Of the Macedonians ( = <foreign lang="greek">su)nedroi</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 32</bibl> et saep.— <cit><quote lang="la">Of the Persians,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 6, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
senatorius: <entryFree id="n43620" type="main" key="se^na_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>senator</etym>, <sense id="n43620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a senator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">senatorial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus aetas a senatorio gradu longe abesset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:21:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 21, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ordo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 18, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 62:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 62, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:104:1" default="NO" valid="yes">104, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsellia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Corn. 1, p. 449</bibl></cit> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <trans><tr>the deliberations of the Senate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <trans><tr>speeches made in the Senate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">album,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:8:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 8, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid tam civile, tam senatorium, quam illud, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:2:7" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 2, 7</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a senator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines nobiles cum paucis senatoriis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:Rep. Ord. 2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> Rep. Ord. 2, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> p. 277 Gerl.</sense></entryFree>
senatrix: <entryFree id="n43621" type="main" key="se^na_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnātrix</orth>, <itype>trīcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female senator</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 638</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
senatus: <entryFree id="n43622" type="main" key="se^na_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕnātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (<sense id="n43622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> senati, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 5</bibl>; Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 484, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 5, 19</bibl>; also cited ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 116</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:36:5" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:53:1" default="NO" valid="yes">53, 1</bibl>. acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 484, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 10</bibl> P.; Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 712</bibl> P.; id. Fragm. ap. Don. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 28</bibl>; also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 4</bibl>, acc. to the pr. man. of the Cod. Medic.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 27</bibl>.—Another form of the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> senatuis, C. Fann. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 116</bibl> P.; Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 484, 19</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">as it seems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 484:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> ib. 484, 19</bibl></cit>, yet the passage itself is wanting.—In old orthog. SENATVOS, S. C. de Bacch.; <case>dat.</case> senato, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 6, 27</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>senex; like <foreign lang="greek">gerousi/a</foreign> from <foreign lang="greek">ge/rwn</foreign>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:28:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 28, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 19</bibl></etym>, <hi rend="ital">the council of the elders</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Senate</hi>, the supreme council in Rome, concerning whose origin, constitution, powers, etc., v. senator; cf. Momms. Hist. of Rome, 1, 113 sqq.; 1, 406 sqq. Am. ed.; Becker, Antiq. 2, 1, p. 339 sq.; 2, 2, p. 385 sq.; 2, 3, p. 210 sq.; <cit><quote lang="la">and the authors there cited: quae (consilium, ratio, sententia) nisi essent in senibus, non summum consilium majores nostri appellassent senatum. Apud Lacedaemonios quidem ii, qui amplissimum magistratum gerunt, ut sunt sic etiam nominantur senes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romuli senatus, qui constabat ex optimatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:12:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 12, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Majores nostri) senatum rei publicae custodem collo caverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:65:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 65, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus rem pu blicam tenuit, ut pleraque senatūs auctori tate gererentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:32:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 32, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut potentia senatus atque auctoritas minueretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum potestas in populo, auctoritas in senatu sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:12:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 12, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec per senatum solvi hac lege possumus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:22:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 22, 33</bibl></cit>.—Freq. in the phrase: senatus populusque Romanus (often written S. P. Q. R.), <hi rend="ital">the Senate and people of Rome</hi>, i.e. <hi rend="ital">the State</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the republic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:37:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 37, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 2, 4</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">very rarely in reverse order: populus et senatus Romanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi Romani senatusque verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:31:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 31, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 37, 7</bibl>; Vitr. praef. 1, 1: senatus (senati, senatuis, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>) consultum, <hi rend="ital">a decree of the Senate</hi> (v. <itype>consulo</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> III.); senatūs auctoritas, the same (v. auctoritas, 4.): censuit senatus, <hi rend="ital">the Senate resolved;</hi> v. censeo, 3. b. (cf. also decerno, I.
