D. 3, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moriendi sensum celeritas abstulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis est sensus in morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:9:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 9, 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Niobe) posuit sensum saxea facta mali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:32" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensum voluptatemque percipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 12</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1671" /> <cb n="SENS" /> —</sense><sense id="n43664.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capacity for feeling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut idem interitus sit animorum et corporum nec ullus sensus maneat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactus corporis est sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:435" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 435</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:361" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 361</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">oculorum, aurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:38:111" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 38, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:16:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 16, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:52:107" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 52, 107</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">videndi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:87:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 87, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">audiendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:18:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 18, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod neque oculis neque auribus neque ullo sensu percipi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam oriretur (tertia philosophiae pars) a sensibus, tamen non esse judicium veritatis in sensibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 8, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res subjectae sensibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gustatus, qui est sensus ex omnibus maxime voluptarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:25:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 25, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus autem interpretes ac nuntii rerum in capite et facti et conlocati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:56:140" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 56, 140</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne animal sensus habet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carent conchae visu, omnique sensu alio quam cibi et periculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 30, 48, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eā parte opus orsus, ut a sensu ejus, averteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43664.3" n="II" level="1"> Mental, <hi rend="ital">feeling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentiment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">emotion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">affection; sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">capacity; humor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inclination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frame of mind</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse in commovendis judicibus eis ipsis sensibus, ad quos illos adducere vellem, permoverer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:45:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 45, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">an vos quoque hic innocentium cruciatus pari sensu doloris adficit?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:46:section=123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 46, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestri sensus ignarus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:27:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 27, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:18:section=47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 18, § 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:53:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 53, 154</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">applicatio animi cum quodam sensu amandi ... ut facile earum (bestiarum) sensus appareat ... sensus amoris exsistit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:8:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 8, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi intellegamus naturā gigni sensum diligendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus me sensus, quanta vis fraterni sit amoris, admonet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utere argumento ipse sensus tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 38, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam molle, tam aut fragile aut flexibile quam voluntas erga nos sensusque civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 16, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae mihi indigna et intolerabilia videntur, ea pro me ipso et animi mei sensu ac dolore pronuntio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:44:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 44, 129</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43664.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thought</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">view</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:35:148" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 35, 148</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valde mihi placebat sensus ejus de re publicā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(orator) ita peragrat per animos hominum, ita sensus mentesque pertractat, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:51:222 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 51, 222 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui est iste tuus sensus, quae cogitatio? Brutos ut non probes, Antonios probes?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissidenti sensus suos aperire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion, 8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensus reconditi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 3, 2</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n43664.5" n="3" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">the common feelings of humanity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the moral sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">taste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discretion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tact</hi> in intercourse with men, often called in full sensus communis (sometimes with hominum), and often in other phrases of similar force: <cit><quote lang="la">ut in ceteris (artium studiis) id maxime excellat, quod longissime sit ab imperitorum intellegentiā sensuque disjunctum, in dicendo autem vitium vel maximum sit a volgari genere orationis atque a consuetudine communis sensus abhorrere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae versantur in sensu hominum communi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 13, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">communis ille sensus in aliis fortasse latuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sit in beneficio sensus communis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 5:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:105:3" default="NO">105, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rarus sensus communis in illā fortunā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:73" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 73</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea sunt in communibus infixa sensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:50:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 50, 195</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vulgaris popularisque sensus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 23, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec oratio longe a nostris sensibus abhorrebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 83</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mirari solebam istum in his ipsis rebus aliquem sensum habere, quem scirem nullā in re quicquam simile hominis habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:14:section=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 14, § 33</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43664.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (in the poets, and also in prose after the Aug. per.), of the thinking faculty, <hi rend="ital">sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">understanding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reason</hi> (syn.: mens, ratio). </sense><sense id="n43664.7" n="1" level="3"> In gen. (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">misero quod omnes Eripit sensus mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:51:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 51, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">tibi sensibus ereptis mens excidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 66, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 631</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 178</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(quibus fortuna) sensum communem abstulit,</quote> <trans><tr>common sense</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 7, 4</bibl></cit> (in another signif., <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">supra</ref></xr>, II. A. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, and infra, 2. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">eam personam, quae furore detenta est, quia sensum non habet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:3:22:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 3, 22, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec potest animal injuriam fecisse, quod sensu caret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:1:section=3" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43664.8" n="2" level="3"> In partic., of discourse. </sense><sense id="n43664.9" n="a" level="4"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signification</hi> (syn.: sententia, notio, significatio, vis; <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug.; freq. in Quint.): <cb n="SENT" /> nec testamenti potuit sensus colligi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 5, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba, quibus voces sensusque notarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is verbi sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:484" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 484</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae verbis aperta occultos sensus habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:20" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ambiguitas, quae turbare potest sensum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba duos sensus significantia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 48</bibl></cit>: <foreign lang="greek">a)llhgori/a</foreign> aliud verbis, aliud sensu ostendit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pomponium sensibus celebrem, verbis rudem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:9:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horum versuum sensus atque ordo sic, opinor, est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">egregie dicta circa eumdem sensum tria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 7:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—Introducing a quotation: <cit><quote lang="la">erat autem litterarum sensus hujusmodi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 20, 8, 4</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen. person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">salvo modo poëtae sensu,</quote> <trans><tr>the meaning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43664.10" n="b" level="4"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a thought expressed in words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sentence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">period</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sensus omnis habet suum finem, poscitque naturale intervallum, quo a sequentis initio dividatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:16" default="NO">7, 10, 16</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer ut sciat, ubi claudatur sensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ridendi, qui velut leges prooemiis omnibus dederunt, ut intra quattuor sensus terminarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verbo sensum cludere multo optimum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence, communes sensus (corresp. with loci), <hi rend="ital">commonplaces</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
senta: <entryFree id="n43665" type="main" key="Senta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Senta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n43665.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place in Dalmatia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noted for a curious cavern</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 45, 44, § 115</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sententia: <entryFree id="n43666" type="main" key="sententi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sententĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>for sentientia, from sentio</etym>, <sense id="n43666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a way of thinking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentiment; a purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n43666.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (cf.: opinio, voluntas, studium). </sense><sense id="n43666.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam sententiae atque opinionis meae voluistis esse participes, nihil occultabo et quoad potero, vobis exponam, quid de quāque re sentiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia et opinio mea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 34, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senis sententia de nuptiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de aliquā re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 4</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">de diis immortalibus habere non errantem et vagam, sed stabilem certamque sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de hac sententiā Non demovebor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:17:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 17, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">de sententiā deducere, deicere, depellere, deterrere, decedere, desistere, etc., v. h. vv.: nisi quid tua secus sententia est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:2:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 95</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi sententia eadem est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhuc in hac sum sententiā, nihil ut faciamus nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā omnes stant sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">perstat in sententiā Saturius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 18, 56</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in sententiā manere, permanere, etc., v. h. vv.: non prima sed melior vicit sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:76:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 76, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">variis dictis sententiis, quarum pars censebant, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant sententiae, quae censerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae numerantur, non ponderantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos quibus Cotta tantum modo locos ac sententias hujus disputationis tradidisset,</quote> <trans><tr>the leading thoughts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">quot homines, tot sententiae,</quote> <trans><tr>many men</tr>, <tr>many minds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 5, 15</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n43666.3" n="2" level="3"> In the phrases, </sense><sense id="n43666.4" n="(a)" level="5"> Sententia est, with <hi rend="ital">subj.-clause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">it is my purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">will</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 24, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si honestatem tueri ac retinere sententia est,</quote> <trans><tr>if one's purpose be</tr>, <tr>if one be determined</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 116</bibl></cit>; and: stat sententia, with <hi rend="ital">obj.clause</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 67</bibl>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">, parenthetically: sic stat sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:243" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 243</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43666.5" n="(b)" level="5"> De sententiā alicujus aliquid facere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:29:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 29, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque ego haud committam, ut si quid peccatum siet, Fecisse dicas de meā sententiā,</quote> <trans><tr>according to my wish</tr>, <tr>to suit me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl>, C, § 11; 7, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 45, 5</bibl> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n43666.6" n="(g)" level="5"> Meā quidem sententiā, <hi rend="ital">in my opinion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as I think</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis stulte faciunt, meā quidem sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meā quidem sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 2, 21</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and simply meā sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 45, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:95 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 95 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43666.7" n="(d)" level="5"> Ex meā (tuā, etc.) sententiā, <hi rend="ital">according to my</hi> (<hi rend="ital">thy</hi>, etc.) <hi rend="ital">wish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam haec evenerunt nostrā ex sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:9:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 9, 89</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 1, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 7, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 15, 1</bibl>; and more freq., simply ex sententiā, <hi rend="ital">to one's mind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">liking</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1</bibl>, <cb n="SENT" /> 1, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:2:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 2, 2, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 5, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:4:5:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 4, 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 5, 4, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:27:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 27, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 43:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 43, 5</bibl> et saep. (v. also infra, B. 2.).—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) Praeter animi sententiam, <hi rend="ital">against one's inclination</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (crapulam) potavi praeter animi mei sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43666.8" n="B" level="2"> In partic., publicists' and jurid. t.t., <hi rend="ital">an official determination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vote</hi> (cf. suffragium): <cit><quote lang="la">SENATVOS SENTENTIAM VTEI SCIENTES ESETIS, EORVM SENTENTIA ITA FVIT, S. C. de Bacch.: (L. Tarquinius) antiquos patres majorum gentium appellavit, quos priores sententiam rogabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:20:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 20, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non viribus ... res magnae geruntur, sed consilio, auctoritate, sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Marcellinus) sententiam dixit, ut, etc. ... postea Racilius de privatis me primum sententiam rogavit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accurate sententiam dixi ... factum est senatusconsultum in meam sententiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">DE SENATVOS SENTENTIAD ... DE PR. VRBANI SENATVOSQVE SENTENTIAD, S. C. de Bacch.: ex senatus sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victos paucis sententiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:61:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 61, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, sententiam dare, <hi rend="ital">to vote</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meae partes exquirendae magis sententiae quam dandae sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 20, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes in eam sententiam ierunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum in hanc sententiam pedibus omnes issent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:56:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 56, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem sequor, aliquem jubebo sententiam dividere,</quote> <trans><tr>to divide the question</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod fieri in senatu solet ... cum censuit aliquis quod ex parte mihi placeat, jubeo illum dividere sententiam et sequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 21:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 21, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, de eventu fortuna judicat, cui de me sententiam non do, <hi rend="ital">I give no vote</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 14, 16</bibl>.—Of the people in the comitia: <cit><quote lang="la">de singulis magistratibus sententiam ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de quo foedere populus Romanus sententiam non tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:15:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 15, 34</bibl></cit>.—Of the <hi rend="ital">votes</hi> of judges: <cit><quote lang="la">itur in consilium: servus ille innocens omnibus sententiis absolvitur, quo facilius vos hunc omnibus sententiis condemnare possitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:45:section=100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 45, § 100</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 26, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">condemnatur enim perpaucis sententiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:30:section=75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 30, § 75</bibl></cit>: M. Cato (judex) sententiam dixit, <hi rend="ital">pronounced the decision</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sentence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 66</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiis paribus reus absolvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 81:26" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 81, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43666.9" n="2" level="3"> Ex animi mei (tui) sententiā, in the formula of an oath, <hi rend="ital">to the best of my</hi> (<hi rend="ital">your</hi>) <hi rend="ital">knowledge and belief</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on my</hi> (<hi rend="ital">your</hi>) <hi rend="ital">conscience</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(majores) jurare ex sui animi sententiā quemque voluerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 146</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ex animi tui sententiā juraris, id non facere perjurium est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:29:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 29, 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:53:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 53, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:15" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 15</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—In a play on this signif. and that of ex sententiā, supra: <cit><quote lang="la">ridicule illud L. Nasica censori Catoni, cum ille: Ex tui animi sententiā tu uxorem habes? Non hercule, inquit, ex animi mei sententiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 260</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 2</bibl> sqq.— <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, as a formula of assurance: <cit><quote lang="la">me quidem, ex animi mei sententiā, nulla oratio laedere potest,</quote> <trans><tr>by my faith</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43666.10" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of words, discourse, etc., <hi rend="ital">sense</hi>, <hi rend="ital">meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signification</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notion</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitum ut possis sentire, neque illam Internoscere, verborum sententiam quae sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 561</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum verbum potest in duas plurisve sententias accipi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 53, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum continenter verbum non in eādem sententiā ponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 39, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formantur et verba et sententiae paene innumerabiliter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:52:201" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 52, 201</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cognitā sententiā verba subtiliter exquiri noluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:20:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 20, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod summum bonum a Stoicis dicitur convenienter naturae vivere, id habet hanc, ut opinor, sententiam: cum virtute congruere semper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec (philosophia) nos docuit, ut nosmet ipsos nosceremus: cujus praecepti tanta vis, tanta sententia est, ut ea non homini cuipiam, sed Delphico deo tribueretur,</quote> <trans><tr>such depth of meaning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legis (with vis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Domitio dixit versum Graecum eādem sententiā, quā etiam nos habemus Latinum: Pereant amici, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,034:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deiot. 9, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est vitium in sententiā, si quid absurdum, aut alienum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Opt. Gen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:52:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 52, 200</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43666.11" n="B" level="2"> Concr. </sense><sense id="n43666.12" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a thought</hi> expressed in words; <hi rend="ital">a sentence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">period</hi>: dum de singulis sententiis breviter<pb n="1672" /> <cb n="SENT" />  disputo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 10, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">est brevitate opus, ut currat sententia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initia et clausulae sententiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:135" default="NO">11, 3, 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:4:26" default="NO">8, 4, 26</bibl>; 9, 4, 18; 9, 4, 29; 10, 1, 130 al.—</sense><sense id="n43666.13" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a philosophical proposition</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an aphorism</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apophthegm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maxim</hi>, <hi rend="ital">axiom</hi> (cf. praeceptum): selectae (Epicuri) brevesque sententiae, quas appellatis <foreign lang="greek">kuri/as do/cas</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:30:85" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 30, 85</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est tam jucundum cognitu atque auditu, quam sapientibus sententiis gravibusque verbis ornata oratio et perpolita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:8:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acutae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concinnae acutaeque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:78:272" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 78, 272</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:2 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 2 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:76" default="NO">9, 3, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:60" default="NO">10, 1, 60</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 3, 120 al.: (Sophocles) sententiis densus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:68" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 68</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:90" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:102" default="NO">10, 1, 102</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">subiti ictūs sententiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 100:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 100, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sententialis: <entryFree id="n43667" type="main" key="sententi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sententĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sententia</etym>, = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">gnwmiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n43667.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the form of a sentence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sententious</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Rhet. 13, p. 499, 22</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 2, 9, 11</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sententĭālĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the form of maxims</hi> or <hi rend="ital">axioms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sententiously</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">et alia plurima, quae sententialiter proferuntur: nec haec apud Vergilium frustra desideraveris (Ecl. 8, 63): Non omnia possumus omnes, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 16</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 18 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sententiola: <entryFree id="n43668" type="main" key="sententi^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sententĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short</hi> or <hi rend="ital">little sentence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">maxim</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">aphorism</hi>: sententiolas edicti cujusdam memoriae mandavi, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:9:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:98" default="NO">9, 2, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:52" default="NO">11, 1, 52</bibl>; 12, 10, 73; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 118, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 12, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sententiose: <entryFree id="n43669" type="main" key="sententi^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sententĭōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. sententiosus <sense id="n43669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sententiosus: <entryFree id="n43670" type="main" key="sententi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sententĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sententia, II. B. 2.</etym>, <sense id="n43670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pithy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sententious</hi> (rare but Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">sententiosum et argutum genus dictionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:95:325" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 95, 325</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sententĭōsē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n43670.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Full of meaning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suggestively</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiose (dicere) sine verborum et ordine et modo (opp. composite) et apte sine sententiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:236" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 71, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratione habitā graviter et sententiose,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:55:106" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 55, 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43670.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Sententiously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe sententiose ridicula dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 286</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
senticetum: <entryFree id="n43671" type="main" key="senti^ce_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sentĭcētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sentis</etym>, <sense id="n43671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a thicket of briers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorn-brake</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 348, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
senticosus: <entryFree id="n43672" type="main" key="senti^co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sentĭcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of briers</hi> or <hi rend="ital">thorns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">briery</hi> (ante- and post-class.); <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: verba, Afr. ap. Fest. s. v. sentes, p. 339 Müll.: merces (with aspera),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 361, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sentifico: <entryFree id="n43673" type="main" key="senti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sentĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>sentio-facio</etym>, <sense id="n43673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to endow with feeling</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sensation</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> Stat. An. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sentina: <entryFree id="n43674" type="main" key="senti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sentīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n43674.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the filthy water that collects in the bottom of a ship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bilgewater</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum alii malos scandant, alii per foros cursent, alii sentinam exhauriant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:6:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nave, quae sentinam trahit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 30:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 30, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces sentinae navium odorem procul fugiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:194 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 70, 90, § 194 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mersamque vitiis suis, quasi sentinā, rempublicam pessum dedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:12:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 12, 7</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43674.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the bottom of a ship where the bilge-water is</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the hold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi Romam sicuti in sentinam confluxerant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 37, 5</bibl></cit>: sedebamus in puppi et clavum tenebamus; <cit><quote lang="la">nunc autem vix est in sentinā locus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:9:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 9, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43674.2" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43674.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The lowest of the people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the dregs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rabble</hi> of a state or city (good prose; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">faex): si tu exieris, exhaurietur ex urbe tuorum comitum magna et perniciosa sentina rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 7</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:15" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 15</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Att. 1:19:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 19, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Agr. 2:26:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 29, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:1:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 1, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43674.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The hangerson</hi> of an army, <hi rend="ital">camp-followers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:7:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sentinaculum: <entryFree id="n43675" type="hapax" key="senti_na_cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sentīnācŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sentino</etym>, <sense id="n43675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument for bailing out the bilge-water of a ship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a scoop</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 36, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sentinas: <entryFree id="n43676" type="main" key="Senti_nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sentīnas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43676.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sentinum</hi> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Sentis</orth> ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 124" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 124</bibl> Goes.; <foreign lang="greek">*se/ntinon</foreign> in Ptol. and Polyb.), <hi rend="ital">a town of Umbria</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 27, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:30:4" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 30, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:31:12" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 31, 12</bibl>; for which, <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Sentinate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:8:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 8, 3</bibl></cit> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.—Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sentīnātes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Sentinum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 14, 19, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sentinator: <entryFree id="n43677" type="main" key="senti_na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sentīnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sentino</etym>, <sense id="n43677.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who</hi> <cb n="SENT" /> <hi rend="ital">bails out the bilge-water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from a ship</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 36, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sentino: <entryFree id="n43678" type="main" key="senti_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sentīno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sentina</etym>. <sense id="n43678.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to bail</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pump out the bilge-water from a ship</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Ep. 36 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Homil. 42" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Homil. 42</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n43678.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be in difficulty</hi> or <hi rend="ital">danger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentinare, satagere, dictum a sentinā, quia multum aquae navis cum recipit periclitatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=339" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 339</bibl></cit> Müll.; Caecil. ib.</sense></entryFree>
sentinosus: <entryFree id="n43679" type="hapax" key="senti_no_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sentīnōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of bilge-water</hi>: naves, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 152, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sentinus: <entryFree id="n43680" type="main" key="Senti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sentīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sentio</etym>, <sense id="n43680.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the deity who gives sensation to new-born infants</hi>, Varr. in Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 11</bibl>; cf. Becker, Antiq. 4, p. 10.</sense></entryFree>
sentio: <entryFree id="n43681" type="main" key="senti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sentĭo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n43681.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sync. sensti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 11</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n43681.1" n="I" level="1"> Physically. </sense><sense id="n43681.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to discern by the senses; to feel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">see</hi>, etc.; <hi rend="ital">to perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be sensible of</hi> (syn. percipio). </sense><sense id="n43681.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calorem et frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 496</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">duritiem saxi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 268</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:381" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 381</bibl> sq.: feram nare sagaci (venaticā), Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=177" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 177</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 346 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">varios rerum odores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 298</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sucum in ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:617 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 617 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suavitatem cibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:45:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 45, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">varios rerum colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nil aegri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:832" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 832</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrumque (calorem et frigus) manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 496</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbos articularios,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 4, 14, § 39</bibl></cit>.—In mal. part.: <cit><quote lang="la">sensit delphina Melantho,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 120</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse prius ad angustias veniri, quam sentirentur,</quote> <trans><tr>before they should be observed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43681.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or an, <hi rend="ital">object-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sei movero me seu secari sensero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: sentio aperiri fores. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 3, 29</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quisquam moriens sentire videtur, Ire foras animam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 607</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentire sonare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 229</bibl></cit> Munro.—</sense><sense id="n43681.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpetuo quoniam sentimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 228</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:935" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 935</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:9:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 9, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (homines) corruant, sed ita, ut ne vicini quidem sentiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43681.6" n="b" level="4"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">pupula cum sentire colorem dicitur album,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:811 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 811 sq.</bibl></cit> —<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud igitur aures per se possunt sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 633</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis corpus sentire refutat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 350</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:354" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 354</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:552" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 552</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:625" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 625</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43681.7" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43681.8" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To perceive</hi> the effects (esp. the ill effects) of any thing; <hi rend="ital">to feel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experience</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suffer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">undergo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">endure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentiet, qui vir siem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam curabo sentiat, Quos attentarit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:5:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 5, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid ipse ad Avaricum sensisset, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:28:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 28, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Centupirini etiam ceterarum civitatum damna ac detrimenta senserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:45:section=108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 45, § 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:12:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 12, 38</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:49:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 49, § 127</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum Philippos et celerem fugam Sensi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Apollinem) vindicem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecos motus orientis austri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 27, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contracta aequora (pisces),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prima arma nostra (Salyi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:2:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentire paulatim belli mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:10:11" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 10, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:64:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 64, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cladem belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 33, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inopiam rerum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 22, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44" default="NO" valid="yes">44</bibl>. 7, 6: <cit><quote lang="la">incommoda belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lassitudo jam et sitis sentiebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi primum dolorem aliquis sentit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 7, 20, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus ulceris dolorem sentire etiam spectantes videntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis aegri vitia sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:29" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui in urbe se commoverit ... sentiet, in hac urbe esse consules vigilantes, esse egregios magistratus, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 12, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 28, 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:864" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 864</bibl>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste tuus ipse sentiet Posterius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:1:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 1, 2, 59</bibl></cit>.—Of beasts, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">oves penuriam sentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus aut aestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praegelidam hiemem omnes pisces sentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 24, § 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43681.9" n="b" level="4"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">to be affected</hi> or <hi rend="ital">influenced by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meae istuc scapulae sentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">transitum exercitus (ager),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:41:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 41, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestilentem Africum (Fecunda vitis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus et mare amorem Festinantis eri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alnos fluvii cavatas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:136 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 136 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:31:5" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 31, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carbunculi cum ipsi non sentiant ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 7, 25, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem (gemma) sola nobilium limam sentit,</quote> <trans><tr>is affected by</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 8, 32, § 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum amnis sentit aestatem, et ad minimum deductus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 3:21:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 3, 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miramur quod accessionem fluminum maria non sentiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Q. N. 3, 4</bibl></cit>: illa primum <cb n="SENT" /> saxa auctum fluminis sentiunt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 4:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">totum mare sentit exortum ejus sideris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 25, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseus vetustatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 42, 97, § 242</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba cariem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 14, § 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum robiginem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 143</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43681.10" n="2" level="3"> In the elder Pliny, <hi rend="ital">to be susceptible of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be subject</hi> or <hi rend="ital">liable to</hi> a disease: <cit><quote lang="la">morbos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 49, 73, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 18, 26, § 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cariem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 12, 7, 14, § 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43681.11" n="II" level="1"> Mentally. </sense><sense id="n43681.12" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to feel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notice</hi> (syn. intellego). </sense><sense id="n43681.13" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">id jam pridem sensi et subolet mihi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 7</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando Aesculapi ita sentio sententiam,</quote> <trans><tr>I observe</tr>, <tr>understand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primus sentio mala nostra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam illum ne minimā quidem re offendi, quod quidem senserim,</quote> <trans><tr>that I have perceived</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:103" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cui bene quid processerit, multum illum providisse, cui secus, nihil sensisse dicamus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesentia numina sentit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 134</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 162</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:73" default="NO"><author>id.</author> C. S. 73</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">de victoriā atque exitu rerum sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia me illa sentire quae dicerem, nec tantum sentire, sed amare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 75:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 75, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum sensisse quae scripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 100:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 100, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut vestram sentirent aequora curam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 557</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec inania Tartara sentit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>does not die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:619" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 619</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43681.14" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or an <hi rend="ital">obj.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam sentio errare (eum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:3:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 3, 2, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc vir excellenti providentiā sensit ac vidit, non esse, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suspicionem populi sensit moveri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod quid cogitent, me scire sentiunt, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:3:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 3, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postquam nihil esse pericli Sensimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non nisi oppressae senserunt (civitates), etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43681.15" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">rel.-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scio ego et sentio ipse, quid agam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam dudum equidem sentio, suspicio Quae te sollicitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:8:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 8, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam sentio, Quae res gereretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid est in me ingenii, quod sentio quam sit exiguum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo fonte hauriam, sentio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victrices catervae Sensere, quid mens rite, quid indoles ... Posset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 25</bibl></cit>.—With the <hi rend="ital">indic.</hi>, in a <hi rend="ital">rel.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sentio, quam rem agitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43681.16" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes postea quam de profectione eorum senserunt,</quote> <trans><tr>became aware of their retreat</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 52</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <case>nom.</case> of <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sensit terrae sola maculans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensit medios delapsus in hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 377</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vehementer mihi est irata: sentio atque intellego,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:6:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 6, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 97</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mentes sapientium cum e corpore excessissent sentire ac vigere (opp. carere sensu),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:21:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 21, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 24, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Aristoteles) paeana probat eoque ait uti omnes, sed ipsos non sentire cum utantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:193" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 57, 193</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:52" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">priusquam hostes sentirent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 4</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ut dictum est, in eo genere intellegitur, sed ut sensum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:42:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 42, 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43681.17" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To feel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">experience</hi> (with <case>acc.</case> of the feeling; <cit><quote lang="la">rare): quidquid est quod sensum habet, id necesse est sentiat et voluptatem et dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:14:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 14, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenesne memoriā quantum senseris gaudium, cum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 4:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non sentire amisso amico dolorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 99:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 99, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">121, 7: victoriae tantae gaudium sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:44:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 44, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">segnius homines bona quam mala sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 21, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43681.18" n="III" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (in consequence of mental perception), <hi rend="ital">to think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imagine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppose</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">opinor, arbitror): si ita sensit, ut loquitur, est homo impurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:21:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 21, 32</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jocansne an ita sentiens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 63</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fleri potest, ut recte quis sentiat, et id quod sentit, polite eloqui non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humiliter demisseque sentire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum aperte, quod sentio, loquar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sentio scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:16:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa est haec sola, in quā omnes sentirent unum atque idem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:7:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idemque et unum sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:43" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapiens de dis immortalibus sine ullo metu vera sentit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 19, 62</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem, quod ego, sentit, te esse huic rei caput,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 29</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nos quidem hoc sentimus: si, etc. ... non esse cunctandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem hanc esse sentiunt omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:chapter=2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1673" /> <cb n="SEOR" /> 3, 6 Madv. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">sensit in omni disputatione id fieri oportere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; 5, 8, 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:28:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 28, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 6, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 7, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic decerno, sic sentio, sic affirmo, nullam rerum publicarum conferendam esse cum eā, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:46:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 46, 70</bibl></cit>.—With two <case>acc.</case> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem bonum civem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:34:125" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 34, 125</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:0" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 0</bibl>, supra, where Orell. omits esse).—With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de illo genere rei publicae quae sentio dixero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:42:65" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 42, 65</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">quid de re publicā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 21, 34</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 38, 60: quid de quo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid gravius de vobis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:32:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 32, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:13:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 13, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui omnia de re publicā praeclara atque egregia sentirent,</quote> <trans><tr>were full of the most noble and generous sentiments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirabiliter de te et loquuntur et sentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">male de illo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: sentire cum aliquo, <hi rend="ital">to agree with one in opinion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tecum sentio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Caesare sentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:49:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc.
