Am. 49, 142</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nae iste haud mecum sentit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 24</bibl></cit>: ab aliquo sentire, <hi rend="ital">to dissent from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagree with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">abs te seorsum sentio,</quote> <trans><tr>judge otherwise</tr>, <tr>think differently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 52</bibl></cit>: ut abs te seorsus sentiam De uxoriā re, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 195</bibl> P.: <hi rend="ital">Gr.</hi> Omnia istaec facile patior, dum hic hinc a me sentiat. <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Atqui nunc abs te stat, <hi rend="ital">is on my side</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 4, 56</bibl> (cf. ab); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: qui aliunde stet semper, aliunde sentiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 45, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43681.19" n="B" level="2"> In partic., publicists' and jurid. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to give one's opinion</hi> concerning any thing; <hi rend="ital">to vote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decide</hi> (syn. censeo): <cit><quote lang="la">sedens iis assensi, qui mihi lenissime sentire visi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae vult Hortensius omnia dicat et sentiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:31:section=76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 31, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si judices pro causā meā senserint,</quote> <trans><tr>decided in my favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: in illam partem ite quā sentitis, Vet. Form. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 20</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sensa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (acc. to II. B.). </sense><sense id="n43681.20" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Thoughts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ideas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceptions</hi> (class. but very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">sententiam veteres, quod animo sensissent, vocaverunt ... Non raro tamen et sic locuti sunt, ut sensa sua dicerent: nam sensus corporis videbantur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exprimere dicendo sensa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 1, 8, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sensa mentis et consilia verbis explicare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 14, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43681.21" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Opinions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">doctrines</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">sensa et inventa Disarii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sentis: <entryFree id="n43682" type="main" key="sentis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sentis</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>acc.</case> sentim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 4</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n43682.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et rubus et sentes tantummodo natae, Ov. de Nuce, 113: tenerae fruticum sentes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 55</bibl></cit>). </sense><sense id="n43682.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A thorn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thornbush</hi>, <hi rend="ital">brier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bramble</hi> (usually in <number>plur.</number>, and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; not in Cic.; but. cf. vepris). </sense><sense id="n43682.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: arbores, vites, vepres, sentes, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 129" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 129</bibl>: <hi rend="ital">He.</hi> Asper meus victus sane est. <hi rend="ital">Er.</hi> Sentesne esitas? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 207</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 4, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 411</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 379</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 382</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 509</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 799</bibl>; *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:3:1 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 3, 1 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n43682.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: Graeci vocant <foreign lang="greek">kuno/sbaton</foreign>, nos sentem canis appellamus, <hi rend="ital">the dogrose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wild-brier</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 4</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n43682.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in Plaut., of <hi rend="ital">thievish hands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 6, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n43683" type="main" key="Sentis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sentis</orth>, v. Sentinas.</entryFree>
sentisco: <entryFree id="n43684" type="main" key="sentisco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sentisco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n43684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [sentio, II.], <hi rend="ital">to perceive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">note</hi>, <hi rend="ital">observe</hi> (Lucretian), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:392" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 392</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:586" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 586</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sentius: <entryFree id="n43685" type="main" key="Sentius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sentius</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n43685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital"> the name of a Roman</hi> gens. </sense><sense id="n43685.1" n="1" level="3"> Sentius Saturninus, <hi rend="ital">a proprœtor in Macedonia</hi>, A. U.C. 671, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:93:section=217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 93, § 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:34:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 34, 84</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43685.2" n="2" level="3"> Cn. Sentius, <hi rend="ital">a governor of Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sentix: <entryFree id="n43686" type="main" key="sentix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sentix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sentis</etym>, <sense id="n43686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant</hi> cynosbatos or sentis canis, <hi rend="ital">dog rose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wildbrier</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 87</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 17, 7, 59 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
sentosus: <entryFree id="n43687" type="main" key="sento_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sentōsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tŭōsus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of thorns</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thorny</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 6,310</bibl>; Fulg. Myth. prol.—</sense><sense id="n43687.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, form sentuosus: stricto et sentuoso brevitatis vinculo, Boëth. in Porphyr. Dial. 1, p. 12.</sense></entryFree>
sentus: <entryFree id="n43688" type="main" key="sentus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43688.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">thorny</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rough</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rugged</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): loca senta situ, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:462" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 462</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:436" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 436</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vepres,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> in Symm. 2, 1039</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apoth. 123</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n43688.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">video sentum, squalidum, aegrum, pannis annisque obsitum (hominem),</quote> <trans><tr>bristly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
seorsum: <entryFree id="n43689" type="main" key="se^orsum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕorsum</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. seorsus. <cb n="SEPA" /></entryFree>
seorsus: <entryFree id="n43690" type="main" key="se^orsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕorsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>abbrev. from sevorsus, from se-vorto</etym>, <sense id="n43690.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sundered</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apart</hi> (syn. separatus). </sense><sense id="n43690.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (so only ante- and post-class.): seorsum atque diversum pretium, Cato ap. Fest. s. v. optionatus, p. 201 Müll.: vocabulum, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:10:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">syllabae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2398" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2398</bibl></cit> P.: <cit><quote lang="la">seorsa quae (videor tractasse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2439" default="NO"><author>id.</author> p. 2439 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> ib.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">studia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 17, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n43690.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕorsum</orth> (often erroneously written <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕorsim</orth>; collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕor-sus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:5:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 5, 2, 27</bibl>; Afran. ap. Charis, p. 195 P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 494</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:448" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 448</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 9, 3</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 42, 8</bibl> Weissenb.; in both forms in the poets; usu. dissyl.; but trisyl. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:551" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 551</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:491" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 491</bibl>. —Another collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sorsum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:631 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 631 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:495" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 495</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:447" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 447</bibl>; cf. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1061" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1061</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apart</hi> (syn. separatim; freq., but mostly ante-class.; not found in Cæs., Verg., or Hor.; and in Cic. only once, in the etymological definition of the word seditio). </sense><sense id="n43690.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">me hodie senex seduxit solum, sorsum ab aedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 95</bibl></cit> Fleck.; so, <cit><quote lang="la">seorsum ab rege exercitum ductare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 70, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seorsum tractandum est hoc ab illo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 4, 7</bibl></cit>: seorsum a collegā omnia paranda, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 9, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">abs te seorsum sentio,</quote> <trans><tr>otherwise</tr>, <tr>differently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 52</bibl></cit>; cf.; ut abs te seorsus sentiam De uxoriā re, Afran. ap Charis, p. 195 P.—</sense><sense id="n43690.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (Lucretian): <cit><quote lang="la">seorsum corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 564</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:631" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 631</bibl></cit> MSS. (Lachm. and Munro, animae).—</sense><sense id="n43690.5" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: quā arte natio sua separata seorsum, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:447 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5,447 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aediculam istanc seorsum concludi volo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep 3, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in custodiā habitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 42, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 52, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castris positis, Auct. B. Afr. 48, 2: ea dissensio civium, quod seorsum eunt alii ad alios, seditio dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:1:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: omnibus gratiam habeo, et seorsum tibi praeterea, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:9:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 9, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proin, viator, hunc deum vereberis, Manumque seorsum habebis,</quote> <trans><tr>wilt hold afar</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 20, 17</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
separ: <entryFree id="n43691" type="main" key="se_pa_r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-pār</orth>, <itype>păris</itype> (perh. only in <sense id="n43691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">different</hi> (syn. dispar; postAug. and mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>)' ossa separe urnā contegere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:58" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 58</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">separe coetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:481" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">separe ductu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 311</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo flumina naturā separi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
separabilis: <entryFree id="n43692" type="main" key="se_pa^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpărābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>separo</etym>, <sense id="n43692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be separated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec (eam vim) separabilem a corpore esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 21</bibl></cit>; a veritate unius Dei, Hilar Trin. 1, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
separate: <entryFree id="n43693" type="main" key="se_pa^ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpărātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. separo, <sense id="n43693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
separatim: <entryFree id="n43694" type="main" key="se_pa^ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpărātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>separo</etym>, <sense id="n43694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separately</hi> (freq. and good prose; syn. seorsum) </sense><sense id="n43694.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(di) separatim ab universis singulos diligunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N D. 2, 66, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil accidet ei separatim a reliquis civibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">separatim a reliquis consilium capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">separatim eos ab illis consulturos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 47, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43694.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg> (so most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sejungi potest separatimque perscribi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:21:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 21, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unā in re separatim elaborare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">separatim singularum civitatium copias collocare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 36</bibl></cit>; so (with singuli) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 44, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl>, prooem. § 7; (with quisque) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 2, 16, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:18:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 18, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:53:198" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 53, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 13, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:76 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 76 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vel separatim dicere de genere universo, vel definite de singulis temporibus, hominibus, causis,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>generally</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:27:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 27, 118</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">separatum exordium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv 1, 18, 26</bibl></cit>).</sense></entryFree>
separatio: <entryFree id="n43695" type="main" key="se_pa^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpărātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43695.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sundering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separation</hi> (rare, but good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">sui facti ab illā definitione separatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:18:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 18, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distributione partium ac separatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congregatio criminum accusantem adjuvat, separatio defendentem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nominum idem significantium (opp. congregare, and corresp. to disjunctio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi et corporis in morte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:8:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam eā separatione ad caedem destinarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43695.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., rhet. t. t. <hi rend="ital">division</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separation</hi>, when a word is inserted between two like words (as duc, <cb n="SEPE" /> age, duc, etc.), Jul. Ruf. de Schem. Lex. § 11.</sense></entryFree>
separativus: <entryFree id="n43696" type="main" key="se_pa^ra_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpărātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>separo</etym>, <sense id="n43696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to separation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disjunctive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separative</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">conjunctio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 412</bibl></cit> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1002</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
separator: <entryFree id="n43697" type="main" key="se_pa^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpărātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he that separates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a separator</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Praescr. 30 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 9, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
separatrix: <entryFree id="n43698" type="main" key="se_pa^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpărātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>separator</etym>, <sense id="n43698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that separates</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas conjunctrix ac separatrix hujuscemodi rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trin. 11:10" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trin. 11, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
separatus: <entryFree id="n43699" type="main" key="se_pa^ra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpărātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of separo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n43700" type="hapax" key="se_pa^ra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpărātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>separo</etym>, <sense id="n43700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parili (crinis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 350, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
separo: <entryFree id="n43701" type="main" key="se_pa^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-păro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>2. paro</etym>, <sense id="n43701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disjoin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sever</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi> (class. and freq., esp. in the trop. sense; cf.: divido, dirimo, disjungo, secludo). </sense><sense id="n43701.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43701.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatoria subsellia a populari consessu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Corn. Fragm. 12, p. 449</bibl></cit> Orell.: <cit><quote lang="la">separat Aonios Oetaeis Phocis ab arvis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiam ab Europā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">separandos a cetero exercitu ratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:2:35" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 2, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43701.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Seston Abydenā separat urbe fretum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:10:28" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">separat (spatium) aethere terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 75</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:524" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 524</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">natura nos ceteris separatos animalibus sola homines fatetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 275</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n43701.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With simple <case>acc.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nec nos mare separat ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ipsis Europam Asiamque separantis freti angustiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 20, § 50</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">equitum magno numero ex omni populi summā separato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thessalorum omnis equitatus separatus erat,</quote> <trans><tr>separated</tr>, <tr>divided</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:19:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 19, § 2</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut corpora gentis illius separata sint in alias civitates, ingenia vera solis Atheniensium muris clausa existimes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:18:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43701.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to treat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">consider separately; to distinguish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">except.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43701.6" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multi Graeci a perpetuis suis historiis ea bella separaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitatione magis a virtute potest quam re separari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:27:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 27, 95</bibl></cit>, suum consilium ab reliquis separare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 63 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ob separata ab se consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 20, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est, quod se ab Aetolis separent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:43:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 43, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orato rem, quem a bono viro non separo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">saepe a figuris ea (vitia) separare difficile est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43701.7" n="(b)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">separemus officium dantis testes et refellentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miscenda sit an separanda narratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:101" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 101</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 13</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus ipsa, separatā utilitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:15:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 15, 34</bibl></cit>: oratio ac vis forensis, ut idem separetur Cato, ita universa erupit sub Tullio, ut, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">if Cato again be excepted</hi> (shortly before: <cit><quote lang="la">praeter Catonem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpărātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">separated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">particular</hi>, <hi rend="ital">different.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43701.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestiones separatae a complexu rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:8:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 8, 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n43701.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">(animalia) separata alienis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43701.10" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ista aliud quoddam separatum volumen exspectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 17, 6</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:17:section=45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 17, § 45</bibl> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neutrum vitiosum separatum est, sed compositione peccatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid separata, quid conjuncta (verba) exigant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum nullum ipsum per se separatum probo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:35:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 35, 54</bibl></cit> Mos. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">privati ac separati agr: apud eos nihil est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">separatae singulis sedes et sua cuique mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">separati epulis, discreti cubilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(exordium) separatum, quod non ex ipsā causā ductum est, nec,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:18:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 18, 26</bibl></cit>: tu (Bacchus) separatis uvidus in jugis (i. e. remotis), <hi rend="ital">distant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remote</hi>, Hor C. 2, 19, 18.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intellectus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 18</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Sup.</hi> does not occur. —Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpărātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">separately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">separatius adjungi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:51:156" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 51, 156</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sepelibilis: <entryFree id="n43702" type="hapax" key="se^pe^li_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕpĕlībĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sepelio</etym>, <sense id="n43702.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be buried;</hi> hence, trop., <hi rend="ital">that may be hidden</hi> or <hi rend="ital">concealed</hi> (a word formed by Plaut.): <cit><quote lang="la">stultitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:1:1:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 1, 1, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sepelio: <entryFree id="n43703" type="main" key="se^pe^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sĕpĕlĭo</orth>, <itype>pelīvi or ii, pultum, 4</itype> (<sense id="n43703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sepeli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:97" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 97</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> sepelitus, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 909</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">fut.</hi> sepelibis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep 25, 61</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> sepelisset, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:17:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 17, 19</bibl>; <pb n="1674" /> <cb n="SEPO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:5:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 5, 16</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to bury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inter</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sepultus intellegitur quoquo modo conditus, humatus vero humo contectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 54, 55, § 187</bibl></cit> (cf. also condo). </sense><sense id="n43703.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: hominem mortuum, inquit lex in XII., in urbe ne sepelito neve urito. Credo vel propter ignis periculum. Quod autem addit, neve urito, indicat, non qui uratur, sepeliri, sed qui humetur. <hi rend="ital">Att.</hi> Quid? qui post XII. in urbe sepulti sunt clari viri? etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:23:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 23, 58</bibl> Mos.: <cit><quote lang="la">quoi (mortuo) auro dentes juncti escunt, ast im cum illo sepelirei ureive se fraude esto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:2:24:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fragm. 2, 24, 60</bibl></cit>: mortuus est, sepelitus est, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 909</bibl> P.: surge et sepeli natum, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 106</bibl>: aliquem, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquinio sepulto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:21:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 21, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suorum corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 42, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sepeli lacrimis perfusa fidelibus ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:14:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 14, 127</bibl></cit>. —Of merging in the sea: <cit><quote lang="la">saevo sepelire profundo exanimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:480" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 480</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43703.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To burn</hi> (the dead body), <hi rend="ital">to perform the funeral rites</hi> of a man <hi rend="ital">by burning</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus corpus procul ab eo loco infoderunt ... inde erutus atque eodem loco sepultus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vos trucidatos incendio patriae sepelire conatus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 38, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepultum Consentiae, quod membrorum reliquum fuit, ossaque Metapontum ad hostes remissa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>buried after burning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepeliri accuratissime imperavit ... evenit ut semiustum cadaver discerperent canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43703.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43703.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To bury</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to overwhelm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">submerge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suppress</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">cerno animo sepultam patriam, miseros atque insepultos acervos civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriā sepultā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:22:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit> (sepulchra, Müll.): <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta tuus sepelivit amor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 15</bibl></cit> (4, 14), 9. haec sunt in gremio sepulta consulatus tui, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnum sepelire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod bellum ejus (Pompeii) adventu sublatum ac sepultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 11, 30</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:75:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 75, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:89:3" default="NO">2, 89, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:90 al" default="NO">2, 90 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to put an end to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:13:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc, cum mea fama sepulta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:5:85" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 5, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem in aeternum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to destroy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 570</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:126:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 126, 2</bibl>: multa tenens antiqua, sepulta, vetustas Quae facit, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:4:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullus sum ... sepultus sum,</quote> <trans><tr>I'm lost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 8</bibl></cit> (7), 50.—</sense><sense id="n43703.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: sepultus, <hi rend="ital">buried</hi> in deep sleep, <hi rend="ital">lulled to sleep</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slumbering</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">somno sepulti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:974" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 974</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:134" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 134</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">invadunt urbem somno vinoque sepultam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:265" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 265</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custode sepulto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 424</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">assiduo lingua sepulta mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 10), 56: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum sepultae distat inertiae Celata virtus,</quote> <trans><tr>slumbering</tr>, <tr>idle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sepes: <entryFree id="n43704" type="main" key="se_pe_s1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-pēs</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sex</etym>, <sense id="n43704.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">six-footed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">populi (formicae),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 177, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n43705" type="main" key="se_pes2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, v. saepes.</entryFree>
sepia: <entryFree id="n43706" type="greek" key="se_pi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">shpi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n43706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cuttle-fish</hi>, having a black, inky liquid, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 29, 45, § 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 7</bibl>.—This liquid was used for ink, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:13" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 13</bibl>; hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">ink</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">furva,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 76</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sepias: <entryFree id="n43707" type="main" key="Se_pi^a^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēpĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*shpia\s a)/kra</foreign>, <sense id="n43707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a promontory of Magnesia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 9, 16, § 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sepicula: <entryFree id="n43708" type="hapax" key="se_pi^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpĭcŭla</orth>, v. saepicula.</entryFree>
sepimen: <entryFree id="n43709" type="main" key="se_pi_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpīmen</orth> = <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpīmentum</orth>, v. saep</entryFree>
sepio: <entryFree id="n43710" type="main" key="se_pi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpĭo</orth>, v. saepio.</entryFree>
sepiola: <entryFree id="n43711" type="hapax" key="se_pi^o^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpĭŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>sepia</etym>, <sense id="n43711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little cuttle-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
seplasia: <entryFree id="n43712" type="main" key="Se_pla_^si^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēplā^sĭa</orth> (ă, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr 123</bibl>; ā, Marcell. Medic. 66), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēplā^sĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 16</bibl>), <sense id="n43712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a street in Capua</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where unguents were sold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Seplasia platea Capuae, in quā unguentarii negotiari sunt soliti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Pis. 11:24, p. 10" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Pis. 11, 24, p. 10</bibl></cit> Orell.; so Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:34:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 34, 94</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 18, § 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:164" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 13, 57, § 164</bibl>: fraus Seplasiae, i. e. <hi rend="ital">ointments adulterated in the</hi> Seplasia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 11, 25, § 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:1:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 1, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi>—In <number>plur.</number>, Pompon. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 20</bibl>.—Hence, * </sense><sense id="n43712.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sēplasĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. unguentum), <hi rend="ital">Seplasian unguent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 76, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43712.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēplasĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dealer in unguents</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4202</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4417</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43712.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">sēplasĭārĭum</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">muropw/lion</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
sepono: <entryFree id="n43713" type="main" key="se_po_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsŭi, pŏsĭtum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n43713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. perf. sync.</hi> sepostus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:378" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 378</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:17:281" default="NO">17, 281</bibl>; but, sepositus,<cb n="SEPT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 84</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to lay apart</hi> or <hi rend="ital">aside; to put by</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pick out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">select</hi>, etc. (class.; not in Cæs.; syn.: sejungo, segrego, recondo). </sense><sense id="n43713.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n43713.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">seponi et occultari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:24:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 24, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid habere sepositum et reconditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:10:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 10, § 23</bibl></cit>; so (with conditus) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:54:112" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 54, 112</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ornamenta seposita (for which, just before, recondita),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:35:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 35, 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ego ad illud fanum (sc. ornandum) sepositum putabam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 15, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivam pecuniam in aedificationem templi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">primitias magno Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:730" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 730</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nonnullos ex principibus legit ac seposuit ad pompam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:47" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se et pecuniam et frumentum in decem annos seposuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:52:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 52, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sors aliquem seponit ac servat, qui cum victore contendat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interesse pugnae imperatorem an seponi melius foret, dubitavere,</quote> <trans><tr>to place himself at a distance</tr>, <tr>withdraw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de mille sagittis Unam seposuit,</quote> <trans><tr>picked out</tr>, <tr>selected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:381" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 381</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43713.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to send into banishment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to banish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exile</hi> (post-Aug.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">relego): aliquem a domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in provinciam specie legationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in secretum Asiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in insulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 46</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 1, 88; 2, 63; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tit. 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43713.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to lay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">set aside</hi> mentally: <cit><quote lang="la">id quod primum se obtulerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43713.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To set apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assign</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appropriate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reserve</hi>, for any purpose, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut alius aliam sibi partem, in quā elaboraret, seponeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:33:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 33, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi ad eam rem tempus,</quote> <trans><tr>to fix</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:42:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 42, 143</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quod temporis hortorum aut villarum curae seponitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiam senectuti seposui,</quote> <trans><tr>have set apart</tr>, <tr>reserved for my old age</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seposuit Aegyptum,</quote> <trans><tr>he sequestered Egypt</tr>, <tr>made it forbidden ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepositus servilibus poenis locus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā de re sepositus est nobis locus,</quote> <trans><tr>made it a special division of the subject</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43713.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">take away</hi> from others, <hi rend="ital">exclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">select</hi>, etc.: Jovem diffusum nectare curas Seposuisse graves, <hi rend="ital">had laid aside</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">had discarded for a while</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:319" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 319</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Graecos) seposuisse a ceteris dictionibus eam partem dicendi, quae, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>to have separated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio suadendi ab honesti quaestione seposita est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with simple <case>abl.</case>: si modo Scimus inurbanum lepido seponere dicto, <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">distinguish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 273</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">sē-pŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and rare). </sense><sense id="n43713.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Distant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remote</hi>, = remotus: <cit><quote lang="la">fons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:20:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 20, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Spect. 3:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> Spect. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 339" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 339</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43713.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Distinct</hi>, <hi rend="ital">special</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mea seposita est et ab omni milite dissors Gloria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 12, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43713.9" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Select</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choice</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestis,</quote> <trans><tr>sumptuous garments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seposito de grege,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:43:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 43, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sepositio: <entryFree id="n43714" type="main" key="se_po^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpŏsĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sepono</etym>, <sense id="n43714.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a laying aside</hi>, <hi rend="ital">setting apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hoarding</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 2, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43714.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A separation</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">si forte qui decimam vovit decesserit ante sepositionem (for which, just before, separata),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:12:2:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 12, 2, § 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sepositus: <entryFree id="n43715" type="main" key="se_po^si^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sēpŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of sepono.</entryFree>
seps: <entryFree id="n43716" type="greek" key="seps1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">seps</orth>, <itype>sēpis</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sh/y</foreign>. <sense id="n43716.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A venomous serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose bite occasioned putrefaction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:764 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 764 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:723" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 723</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc. sing.</hi> sepa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 102</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc. Plur.</hi> sepas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 2, 29, § 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. Grammat. 12, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43716.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An insect</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">the wood-louse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">milleped</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 2, 6, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:137" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 39, § 137</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n43717" type="main" key="seps2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">seps</orth>, v. 1. saepes.</entryFree>
sepse: <entryFree id="n43718" type="hapax" key="sepse"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sepse</orth>, <sense id="n43718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pron. reflex. fem.</hi> [se - ipse], <hi rend="ital">one's self.</hi> quae (virtus) omnes magis quam sepse diligit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 8</bibl> (also cited by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 108:32" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 108, 32</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
septa: <entryFree id="n43719" type="main" key="septa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. saepio <sense id="n43719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
septages:
<entryFree id="n43720" type="main" key="septages"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septages</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Indian</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">yi/ttakos</foreign>, <sense id="n43720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parrot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 41, 58, § 117</bibl>.
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">septăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">e(pta/s</foreign></etym>, <hi rend="ital">the number seven</hi>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
septejugis: <entryFree id="n43721" type="gloss" key="septe^ju^gis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septĕjŭgis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. currus) [septem-jugum; cf. <sense id="n43721.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">1. sejugis],</quote> <trans><tr>a team of seven</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 337, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septem: <entryFree id="n43722" type="main" key="septem"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem</orth>, <sense id="n43722.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">num. adj. indecl.</hi> [Sanscr. saptan; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">e(pta/</foreign>; Goth. sibun; Germ. sieben; Engl. seven], <hi rend="ital">seven</hi>: septem menses sunt, <cb n="SEPT" /> quom, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dis, quibus septem placuere colles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem et decem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem et septem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 21, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem septemque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Cato, 1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cato, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem septem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 15, 2</bibl></cit> Weissenb.; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 1170</bibl> P.; <cit><quote lang="la">v. also septendecim: septem et viginti minae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:3:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 3, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem et triginta annos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:10:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 10, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sex aut septem loca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 577</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also unconnected: illum his mensibus Sex septem non vidisse proximis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sex septem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 58</bibl></cit>.—With numerals: <cit><quote lang="la">VI. VII. diebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 6</bibl></cit> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem miracula,</quote> <trans><tr>the seven wonders of the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:6:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 6, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.;</hi> so, septem mira, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 24, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">septem spectacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:18:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 18, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43722.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n43722.2" n="A" level="2"> As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the seven sages</hi> of Greece: <cit><quote lang="la">eos vero septem, quos Graeci sapientes nominaverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 7, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:2:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 4, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (Bias) sapiens habitus est unus e septem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thales, qui sapientissimus in septem fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n43722.3" n="B" level="2"> Septem Aquae, <hi rend="ital">a lake in the Reatine territory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 15, 5</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43722.4" n="C" level="2"> Septem Stellae, for septentriones, <hi rend="ital">the seven-stars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Pleiades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 443" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 443</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n43722.5" n="D" level="2"> Septem Maria, <hi rend="ital">the lagunes at the mouth of the Po</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Venice was afterwards founded</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 15, 16, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
september: <entryFree id="n43723" type="main" key="September"><orth extent="full" lang="la">September</orth>, <itype>bris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>septem; as, October, Novem-ber, Decem-ber; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=34" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 34</bibl> Müll.</etym>, <sense id="n43723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the seventh month</hi> of the Roman year, reckoning from March, i. e. our ninth, <hi rend="ital">September</hi> (consisting, as now, of thirty days); <cit><quote lang="la">usually with mensis: mense Septembri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:31" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Without mensis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. de Mens. Monos. 9</bibl>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> Dist. 18; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> Quot. Kal. 8 al.—As <pos>adj.</pos>, with other substantives, <hi rend="ital">of September</hi>, <hi rend="ital">September-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Kalendis Septembribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 22</bibl></cit>; XIX. Kal. Septemb. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:14" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 14</bibl>); XIII. Kal. Septemb. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:20" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 20</bibl>), etc.... pridie Kal. Septemb. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:31" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> 31</bibl>) ... Calendis Septemb.... quarto Nonas Septemb. (Sept. 2) ... Non. Septemb. (Sept. 5) ... VII. Idus Septemb. (Sept. 7) ... tertio Idus Septembris (Sept. 11) ... Id. Sept. (Sept. 13), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:57 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 57 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idibus Septembribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 3</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 83</bibl>: Septembribus horis, <hi rend="ital">in the</hi> (unhealthy) <hi rend="ital">time of September</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 16</bibl> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
septemchordis: <entryFree id="n43724" type="main" key="septemchordis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-chordis</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-cordis</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>chorda</etym>, <sense id="n43724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with seven strings</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cithara,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Or. 3, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septemdecim: <entryFree id="n43725" type="main" key="septemde^cim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septemdĕcim</orth>, v. septendecim.</entryFree>
septemfariam: <entryFree id="n43726" type="main" key="septemfa_ri^am"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septemfārĭam</orth>, v. septifariam.</entryFree>
septemfluus: <entryFree id="n43727" type="main" key="septemflu^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-flŭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>fluo</etym>, <sense id="n43727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sevenfold-flowing</hi>, an Ovidian epithet of the Nile (as having seven mouths): <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:422" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 422</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina Nili,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:15:753" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 753</bibl></cit> (cf. the foll. art. and septemplex).</sense></entryFree>
septemgeminus: <entryFree id="n43728" type="main" key="septemge^mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-gĕmĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sevenfold</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus (as having seven mouths),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:11:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 11, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:800" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 800</bibl> (cf. the preced. art. and septemplex): <cit><quote lang="la">Roma (the city of seven hills),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:2:191" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 2, 191</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septemgemino Roma jugo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septemmestris: <entryFree id="n43729" type="main" key="septemmestris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-mestris</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">septĭmestris</orth>), <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mensis</etym>, <sense id="n43729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of seven months</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">infans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Censor.</author> de Die Nat. 8, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">septimestris partus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11</bibl></cit>, § 2.</sense></entryFree>
septemnerva: <entryFree id="n43730" type="main" key="septemnerva"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-nerva</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>septem-nervus</etym>, <sense id="n43730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> plantago, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septempedalis: <entryFree id="n43731" type="hapax" key="septempe^da_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-pĕdālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n43731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of seven feet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">seven feet high</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septemplex: <entryFree id="n43732" type="main" key="septemplex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-plex</orth>, <itype>plĭcis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>plico</etym>, <sense id="n43732.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sevenfold</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): clipeus (consisting of layers of ox-hides, the Homer. <foreign lang="greek">e(ptabo/eion sa/kos</foreign>, Il. 7, 220 sq.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:925" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 925</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 2</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:95" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 95</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">Nilus (as having seven mouths),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:187" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 187</bibl></cit> (cf. septemfluus and septemgeminus); so, <cit><quote lang="la">Ister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:189" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Spiritus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carm. adv. Marc. 4, 128</bibl></cit>: Spiritus Sancti gratia, Ambros. Jac. et Vit. Beat. 2, 9, 39; <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ecclus. 20, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
septempliciter: <entryFree id="n43733" type="main" key="septempli^ci^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septemplĭcĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>septemplex</etym>, <sense id="n43733.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a sevenfold manner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:30:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 30, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septemtrio: <entryFree id="n43734" type="main" key="septemtri^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septemtrĭo</orth>, v. septentriones. <pb n="1675" /> <cb n="SEPT" /></entryFree>
septemvir: <entryFree id="n43735" type="main" key="septemvir"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septemvir</orth>, v. septemviri.</entryFree>
septemviralis: <entryFree id="n43736" type="main" key="septemvi^ra_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septemvĭrālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>septemviri</etym>, <sense id="n43736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the septemvirs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">septemviral</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 9, 23</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">septemvĭrāles</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the septemvirs</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:12:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 13, 12, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septemviratus: <entryFree id="n43737" type="main" key="septemvi^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septemvĭrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n43737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the office of the septemvirs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the septemvirate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septemviri: <entryFree id="n43738" type="main" key="septemvi^ri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septem-vĭri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (-virūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 6, 5, 14</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vir</etym>, <sense id="n43738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a board</hi> or <hi rend="ital">college of seven men</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the septemvirs.</hi> </sense><sense id="n43738.1" n="I" level="1"> Of the epulones (v. epulo, 2.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 64</bibl>; <number>sing.</number> septemvir, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:602" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 602</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:2:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 2, 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2365</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n43738.2" n="II" level="1"> For dividing lands, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 5, 14</bibl>; <number>sing.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 19, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
septemzodium: <entryFree id="n43739" type="main" key="Septemzo_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Septemzōdĭum</orth>, v. Septizonium.</entryFree>
septenarius: <entryFree id="n43740" type="main" key="septe_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">septēnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>septem</etym>, <sense id="n43740.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing seven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of seven</hi>, <hi rend="ital">septenary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerus,</quote> <trans><tr>the number seven</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 36, 43, § 120</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:10:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 10, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn.
